restaurant_user_12_review:
When we walked in and sat at the chefs counter, I observed a kitchen in harmony, preparing delicious smelling/looking food. I looked over their wine list(very fairly priced) and ordered the wine pairing for the 14 course tasting menu. The wife and I loved the balance in the menu starting out light and working its way to red meat. No course was too heavy on meat or seafood, and every flavor blended in perfectly within each course. Service was better than amazing. The chefs were personable, and I was gifted extra rounds of drinks. The wine selection inspired me to buy a bottle to take home. The Italian love put into the food made the course structure worth it. At the price we paid, we felt that the food was a steal. We will return 100%
(if only there was a 10/5 star option on yelp to accent the quality)
restaurant_user_13_review:
My wife and I don't usually do fancy dinners out, so I'm by no means an expert in the finest cuisine. But we had a special occasion to celebrate and decided to give Altura a try. And given the hefty price (dinner for two was $500 with two glasses of wine and gratuity) the most important question I can help answer: Is it worth it? And I think the answer is a resounding yes!
The service was excellent, but I think that's expected. What was less expected was the ingenuity of the courses, the wonderful taste, the fact that we had to make almost no decisions other than provide our dietary restrictions and preferences and were very positively surprised with every meal that was brought out.
Make sure to make reservations at least a few weeks ahead of time and don't be shy to share all your preferences when you make your reservation (they are very nice about avoiding things you can't eat). If you forgot, that's ok, I had forgotten to let them know to avoid dairy when I made a reservation and o lot told them during our visit and they did a great job to accommodate the courses.
Great for a romantic dinner for two but we saw larger groups with up to 6 people and they seem to have a great time.
Big fan!
restaurant_user_14_review:
After making plans to travel to Seattle, the first thing on the list was finding a nice restaurant to celebrate our 1 year wedding anniversary. I ended up being torn between Metropolitan Grill and Altura, but ended up picking Altura despite it having less reviewers and a lower rating. The food at Altura looked more inventive and I was interested in having something different. I know my intro is very long, but I think it provides context. I think it's necessary to highlight the importance of meeting the customers expectations when they seek a dining experience that matches the special event being celebrated.
1. The staff is wonderful. They were professional, courteous and efficient.
2. The food is inventive and the ingredients are high-quality. The duck-best I've had and the wagyu steak was pretty darn perfect. I will say that of all the courses, I only enjoyed the pastas and main entrees, the rest of the apps didn't taste good at all and were only satisfying to the eye. The dessert was good too, but that's expected. You can't really mess up dessert.
3. Presentation was spot on and the timing of the courses was very well executed. The dishes were all specially designed for the courses and it's something I appreciate.
Now for the disappointments:
1. Rating: In Seattle, the food quality standards are described using face emojis. Excellent, Good, Okay, Needs to Improve. I was shocked to see that Altura only had a "Good" rating. It was the first thing I saw and it was very off-putting. I read the description for "good" and it's not good. Basically it's possible that Altura has some red-level violations, just not enough times to get an "okay" rating. Anything below the top for this kind of restaurant is again, unacceptable. Clean up your act Altura.
2. Punctuality: My husband and I arrived at 9pm and didn't get seated until 9:42. Just not acceptable for a $$$$ restaurant. Reservation made far in advance with a mandatory $200 deposit have to be prioritized and 100% timely. I can understand 15 min.. but nearly 45 min late.. ridiculous. I will give credit where credit is due, the host offered glasses of Prosecco as a mia culpa.
3. Venue: The restaurant itself is nothing special. The place in general is very unkept and it doesn't seem like much of the money the restaurant makes is invested back into decor or maintenance. There is no waiting area.. something they need if they're not going to be timely. There are a couple of chairs near the host bar and whoever sits in one of them will have coats hanging over their head. The baseboards are dirty and pretty beaten up. You can tell they only clean where they have to. There's no white glove standard here. The mirrors have streaks and there's dirt and dust under the parts that the broom or mop can't reach. The bathroom is also unkept and pretty subpar for such and expensive restaurant.
I took pictures, but they seem to have the same menu posted several times by others so I'll spare you with the exception of the food rating chart.
If you're looking for your experience to match the high cost, skip Altura.
restaurant_user_15_review:
Throwback to such amazing experience at @altura on my birthday. Probably the best fine dining in Seattle that I've ever had: perfection from the service, ambiance to excellent tasting menu. I kept being impressed every time new dish coming out :O . Beautiful presentation and creative combinations make everything so delicious and worth the pay!!!
P/s: Though I never expected to be full eating at fine dining restaurants but all those small bites from @altura actually made me pretty stuffed for the whole night!!
restaurant_user_16_review:
The creative ideas and the ambience and customer service are exceptional. No condescending look if you don't want wine matching. Very swift and punctual throughout the dinner. But do expect a 2.5-3 hours dinner since waiting for food just takes a while.
But the taste of the food have big swings among the dishes.
For $137, we get about 8 appetizers, 5 entrees and 3 dessert. Out of 8 appetizers, there are only 2-3 that actually taste normal. Some of them are way too salty, some of them are just a combination of weird flavors. I don't even know how you can make food taste so bad. The conclusion I get is they are trying too hard to be creative. It ended up the ones that have simpler ingredients actually taste the best... Even though they might look the most exciting.
The 5 entrees are generally pretty good. The celebration of winter shellfish is good other than the clam is not salty. The Gnocchi is amazing to smell and taste since we sat at the counter. The steak is definitely a highlight. The quality of phenomenal and it is cooked to the optimal tenderness and flavor. No wonder no more entrees after the steak.
The dessert is okay. Liked the bourbon caramel semifreddo the most but overall a bit too sweet. It was my birthday so they used the chocolate sauce to the draw out a happy birthday message on the last dish which is cute.
Overall good experience will recommend it for special occasion but definitely not coming back.
restaurant_user_17_review:
Altura has long been on my list for an indulgent dinner and I finally took the opportunity to make it out here last night. I've been to more tasting menus than I can count and the experience here feels slightly different than most, which may or may not be a good thing depending on what you prefer.
The space is really small (hey, this is Seattle) and while it doesn't really confer to me a full tasting menu experience a la Michelin like others claim (not that that's necessarily what a chef aspires to), it's really cool to see what the team is able to do with such limited space. The tabletop coal fire was placed right in front of me and was used throughout the night-- it was interesting to watch the duck breast hang over the fire and absorb some of the smoke wafting up to it and to see the oysters being grilled. The open kitchen concept comes with its potential pitfalls, though. When the team has to huddle and catch up it's awkward as a patron to see obvious conflict/turmoil happening.
The number of small bites could have made a full meal by themselves, but the amount of work that went into each was obvious. Some courses were a miss for me-- the shellfish and surprisingly the cheese courses I didn't really enjoy. The cooking was good enough to *almost* make me like olives. Most courses though were really enjoyable-- I'd kill to know how the fermented potato course was made as well as how they made the ragu so damn good. The affogato course gave the experience a feeling of a proper closing. This is the only restaurant outside of Eleven Madison Park that I've been to that is bold enough to make a dry-aged duck course, which was done extremely well.
Overall I'm super happy to have come here and hope for the business's continued success. Really, I just want to eat the dry-aged duck every night for the rest of my life.
restaurant_user_18_review: I've been back three times since my initial review back in 2016, and I can scarcely remember that I ever had bad service. The food and the service have all been outstanding every visit since then, and even if there was a dish that wasn't my favorite, it was always balanced and made sense. Seattle is all about simplicity so we are lucky to have a restaurant that isn't just about simply good food, but good food that is a true experience.
restaurant_user_19_review:
I was at Altura to celebrate a friend's birthday and, now that I have relocated to anothet city, it was definitely one of the most aesthetically, tastefully and ambiance wise, memorable meals I had in Seattle.
The menu is a fix prixe multi course and changes regularly depending on available ingredients, and you can opt for optional courses like truffle/cheese or steak plate s and/or pairing drinks (alcoholic and non alcoholic options). We had the multi course meal (everyone who went to the restaurant had to pretty much had the same thing here...with some accommodations for dietary restrictions, of course), added on the truffle/cheese course and got the half alcoholic/non alcoholic and another non alcoholic pairing.
The courses were all wonderful. They were beautifully plated and all tasted great. There wasn't a dish that I didn't enjoy honestly. I think what helped too was the portion of each dish was right. It was light and wasn't too much in quantity that you ended up feeling stuffed over the course of the meal.
I also appreciated the staff with great service mind. Even though it was a high end restaurant, the staff was friendly and there wasn't a stuffy atmosphere at all. In fact, the ambiance was intimate and they really took the time to pace out the meal and cater for each table (I knew this because we sat at the bar so we saw a bit of actions/preparations that went into their work!).
Overall, I loved the meal there. Altura will definitely be among my top picks for Seattle for those looking to celebrate special occasions.
P.S. if possible, get the bar seating of you are inclined to also observe some kitchen show and definitely make a reservation ahead of time!
restaurant_user_20_review:
I visited this place when my mom came to see me in late September. We had an amazing experience, and here are the pros and cons I see:
Pros:
1. they have a nonalcoholic pairing option, which is very friendly for drivers.
2. most of the dishes were super great, and we found many of them having interesting and also enjoyable tastes.
3. service was good and very quick.
Cons:
1. I ordered their 4oz wagu steak. The steak is definitely not the top grade that would melt in your month. The taste is closer to the Australia wagu (they said the steak comes from Hokkaido). Also there were some vessels in the steak which were hard to cut. My mother had the dry aged duck. I also tasted a small piece and I felt it was a bit over cooked and dry. I don't know if it is potentially related to its dry aged nature. But in general I feel the main dishes (both beef and duck) were the least impressive ones in the whole course.
2. I asked for a table, and they placed us at the corner table which is right below the stairs. It was noisy every time someone used the stairs. There were planety of other tables empty but I don't know why they put us at that particular table.

restaurant_user_1_review:
I was traveling alone for business and wanted a relaxed, upbeat place to grab dinner and a drink at the bar. This place fit the bill with great food and a fun vibe. The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially when they mailed the shopping bag I left behind back to me in Philadelphia.
I will definitely make sure to stop back in the next time I'm in town.
restaurant_user_2_review:
Came here tonight for an impromptu dinner date and left very satisfied. This place, besides being slightly hard to find, is the cutest little nook in downtown Seattle. You feel as if you're in a completely different world vs the touristy pike place corridor.
We arrived around 6:55 PM and were pleasantly surprised it was still happy hour. The deal is actually quite good - $4 off cocktails! I ordered a mezcal cocktail (what's new?) and husband ordered old fashioned. We asked for them less sweet and they turned out great. Mine had a ginger syrup which was different vs most mezcal cocktails I've ordered!
For food, ordered brussel sprouts and beet deviled eggs to start, and split the mussels and burger for the mains. The brussel sprouts were recommended by the server. They were good, not great. Felt like I could make them myself and wouldn't order again for $12. The deviled egg was the perfect party in my mouth and something I had never tasted before! It had a slice of anchovy in it which sounds odd but tasted amazing. Burger was perfectly cooked with a nice crispy bun. The fries were cooked crisp to perfection. Mussels were in perhaps the best sauce I've ever had.
Overall food was so tasty, service was quick and attentive despite restaurant being completely full, and menu comprehensive! Will come back for sure - especially now that we know HH runs until 7 pm on weekdays!
restaurant_user_3_review:
I came to Zig Zag for dinner and had a great experience in the end. My visit didn't start off great, though. The service was slow. On the night I was at Zig Zag, the restaurant was no more than 50% full. Nevertheless, I still waited nearly 25 minutes for my food.
That being said, the food was definitely worth the wait. I had the Wild Mushroom Farro, and it was the best farro I've ever had in my life! The flavor was completely balanced, with no one ingredient dominating the dish. I was also impressed with how they incorporated huckleberry into the dish. On top of that, the sauce - which I'm told was just vegetable stock with butter - was phenomenal. My only minor complaint was that some of the cauliflower was burnt. But the dish was so perfect in every other way that I can definitely overlook the cauliflower.
restaurant_user_4_review: Met a friend here for some cocktails and it was really nice. I appreciated the vibe and that it wasn't super crazy loud. We got to hang out at a standing table and order our first drink before a table opened up, but it wasn't long until one did even though it was Friday night. The drink selection was awesome, and everything we ordered was great (and cleverly named). We also enjoyed our reasonably priced olives and Marcona almonds... good food, great drinks, nice vibe...
restaurant_user_5_review:
Came here for a drink Saturday night.
Cool, chill, vibe. Super low key. Little bit hidden but follow the signs down the stairs. We didn't have to wait and were seated right away. We got two cocktails and be warned they are super strong.
They have a large selection of different kinds of drinks as well as a late night menu. We didn't try any of the food but it all looked amazing.
restaurant_user_6_review:
Wow what a great find on a work trip! There's so many places to choose from right here in the Pike Place Market area. Lucky me, I landed at Zig Zag!
Service from Anna and Erin was spot on a dm fabulous. Technically, I believe Anna was my server yet Erin bought several things and was very attentive as well. It kinda worked as tag team service and that was just fabulous!
All the food was spot on, they had plenty of gluten-free options and the happy hour wine was very good.
My only complaint is that I ate way too much because the food was so great! My hotel is around one plus miles ...uphill. Ugh. It'll be good for me, right?!? Super good, I'll be back!
restaurant_user_7_review:
This place savings grace is there zig zag burger with the fried egg. That was absolutely delicious. The yolk just gushed out everywhere. Felt like I was eating a breakfast sandwich one minute and then the next second a bacon cheese burger. Also the cheese just oozed out of everywhere. Very delicious. The fries were a bit too salty for my taste though. Score: 5/5
Their snacks were very boring. The baguette with the cultured butter was good though. It comes toasted but my only compliant is that I eat too fast and the outside of the bread is too hard :(
The cheese platter was smelly!!!! It's not my cup of tea but I'm sure other people will love it
restaurant_user_8_review:
As a tourist to Pike Market, it was fun to dig out this hidden gem. My bar tender friend suggest me here for cock tails. And yes, def a great spot for happy hour drinks then a walk around to enjoy the sunset.
The drink menu is huge, and the bartender is quite knowledgable about almost everything. I like the atmosphere too, as a weekday early evening, it's already a full house, towns of locals and tourists like me here for their happy hour.
I would def come back and try more items.
restaurant_user_9_review:
What a hidden(?) gem!
Great cozy restaurant and their service was fantastic. Small selections of wines but they were really good wines and reasonable.
Ordered A charcuterie plate, fried oysters, burgers and mussels. The plate was so tasty and the meats were perfectly cured, their mousse was just melt in my mouth.
Mussels were so plumped and juicy. Creamy curry? Sauce was as good as mussels. Their burgers were seasoned right and right size. Not to small or big.
Fried oysters were my fave. Small size and sweet. Everything we ordered was just divine. I would go back there for HH next time. Sooo laidback vibes and the foods were excellent!!
restaurant_user_10_review:
Looking for a classy, undercover jazz cafe with dim lighting, friendly staff and sleek design that totally takes you away from everyday life? Your answer: Zig Zag Cafe. Skillfully tucked away from Pike's Place market, close to the waterfront, Zig Zag offered superbly crafted cocktails and the perfect aperitif options to take a breather prior to continuing our tour of the city.
The lighting is dimly lit with old antique bottles of wine (some unopened) and cozy red lighting that makes you feel stuck in time. Each table is decked out with a candle as humble chandeliers decorate the ceilings.
We ordered a dish of deliciously tasting green & black olives with the perfect amount of garlic and zest. Complimented by a dish of pita bread and heated hummus (spiced with paprika and garlic), the food was delicious! For my cocktail, I ordered an aperol spritz - aperol campari mixed with good quality prosecco and orange zest with enough punch to keep me going.
Overall outstanding dining experience. Highly recommend! A+
restaurant_user_11_review: I had a great experience here. I've heard a lot of good things about Zig Zig and I'm so happy I've finally made my way there to experience it myself. I ate the fries and deviled eggs off their late night menu. I loved the sultry smokey ambiance and the bartender was great. I just loved watching the art that goes into crafting their perfect cocktails. I had a simple Moscow mule, perhaps next time I'll try one of their house cocktails. The deviled eggs were so yummy! Maybe I'll be back soon to try more food!
restaurant_user_12_review: Went with a small group of friends last night and we were seated pretty quickly. Drinks aren't super cheap but you definitely get your money's worth. Shared a squid pro quo and it was delicious. Only negative I would mention is that we were sitting near the door and it was a bit chilly.
restaurant_user_13_review: Nice atmosphere, wait staff prompt and friendly. Food was good. The fried clams and mussels were great. The whisky drinks even better. I love the red lighting and music.
restaurant_user_14_review: Even though I'm a life long Seattleite, last night was my first time to the Zig Zag Caf√©. The area around Pike Place is incredible now that the viaduct has been demolished, and I hope local businesses benefit from that. I loved the Zig Zag Caf√©, excellent drinks, good food and great staff. Our server was very friendly and very accommodating when I realized too late that I had ordered something that didn't agree with my tastes. Much appreciated, and I won't wait so long for my next visit!
restaurant_user_15_review: Dark and cozy, with delicious bites and strong cocktails. We had deviled eggs, the pork skins, and almonds and olives for snacks before dinner at Cutters. The eggplant dip with the pork skins was the highlight. It was silky smooth, and not like baba ganouj, if that's what you were thinking. There's an off-menu cocktail-with-a-story, if you're interested. Called the Chas, it's bourbon, Cointreau, and other potent tastiness. A Pike Place institution, you must come to Zig Zag if you're in Seattle.
restaurant_user_16_review: We stumbled upon this restaurant walking from pikes place down the water before heading over the smith tower. Zig Zag has the best mixologist in Seattle with a wide range of spirits. The food was wonderful, the staff was great and it's in a good location. The mixed drinks were excellent. An eggplant dish was superb, perfectly cooked and with the right garnish. The place is very cozy and very relaxing. The server was great in giving suggestions and the drinks were great.
restaurant_user_17_review:
BEST HAPPY HOUR. So many fun drinks and yummy snacks. They have one of the most extensive cocktail menus I've ever seen and it was hard to decide on just one (okay, two) to try. For snacks we had the fries which have a great balance of salt and dress black pepper and the crispy pig skin which came with a fantastic aioli.
We arrived around 5:30 and were able to get a seat on their small patio, but the inside looked nice too if the patio is full.
restaurant_user_18_review: Definitely a place to visit and hang around. The barman was the best. And I don't even drink!
restaurant_user_19_review: Great place for a drink at dusk....very nice selection of drinks and food. Bartenders very knowledgeable
restaurant_user_20_review: Had appetizers and drinks with a friend. Tasty all around! Fun little spot and nice patio area.

restaurant_user_1_review:
First time visit, went with coworkers for HH. In a nutshell...
Great cocktails- it's always fun to try new drinks or their take on old drinks.
Super friendly staff- our server spent quality time explaining the cocktails and foods. We ended up taking many over her recommendations and enjoyed them. She was prompt and efficient. When we were asking questions about the food preparation she sent out the chef to answer our questions.
Food- oh wow. The wings are delicious as were the twice fried chicken thigh nugget thingys although I never tasted the sriracha in the dipping sauce. This was the first time I have ever had mac and cheese that was al dente and the pork on top was tender and flavorful. Cheese puffs were ok and the smashed potatoes were delicious also.
I love this place and would recommend it highly!!!!
restaurant_user_2_review:
$2 Oyster Happy Hour!
Lady Jaye deserves five stars for that alone, but here's a list of her other sparkling qualities:
Sophisticated (cocktails)
Ambitious (food)
Zero attitude (staff is so genuine and friendly!)
Smells amazing (like wood smoke and pretty people)
Try Lady Jaye, don't let her be the one that got away.
restaurant_user_3_review:
I was recommended by a friend to try this place out for brunch and I recommend you should too!
We came on a Saturday morning for brunch and I ordered the Hobo Scramble. I didn't know what to expect, but let's just say -- I finished the entire plate. That little biscuit was AMAZING! I can't tell you enough. As my friend would put it "I want to live in this biscuit" -- then the Hobo Scramble had a little bit of everything, bacon, ham, sausage, potato, and eggs. Perfection.
The restaurant is super cute, good size dining area. The inside also has a bar area with a few TVs. It looks like they have an outdoor area for the summer times. For a rainy Saturday morning, it was decently busy in there!
I highly recommend you stop by for brunch. I can't wait to go back for dinner!
restaurant_user_4_review:
Let me tell you, this restaurant does a fine job on their food! I ordered the pork cheek Mac and cheese, forever smoked turkey drum, burrata cheese, pimento cheese puffs, butter Lettuce, oysters, and my fav garlic prawns! The meat dishes here are so flavorful and tender; honestly I felt ready to hibernate afterwards
The Burrata cheese is paired with stir fried string beans and sweet tomato topped with onion crisps. The big Burrata on top was so amazing but this dish was honestly a little confusing. I was expecting a salty taste but the sweet tomato really overshadowed the whole dish. It was def a surprising dish, not bad but I couldn't eat a lot of it. So I ate all the Burrata instead lol
The butter Lettuce had a Smokey taste but a little bland. The real highlight of the meal was all the meats and the garlic prawns. So tender and flavor! Those are must try dishes!
restaurant_user_5_review:
Shrub Zero $7: Even though I enjoy making shrubs at home now because I love vinegar. I'll still try it when I'm out for new flavor ideas. The rotating flavor that day was huckleberry and it was a really pretty flavor. I'm not sure if the huckleberry was just overpowering or I've become so used to shrubs the vinegar doesn't hit me as much anymore, but it was still nice and refreshing.
Smoked Bologna Sandwich $14: This is also available during brunch which is Saturday and Sunday 10 AM - 2 PM. I ended up not really liking the mustard on this, and it kind of took over the sandwich flavor wise. It's been ages since I've had a bologna sandwich in my school days, but the meat on this didn't taste super different from what I remember. I did enjoy the broken potatoes as the side.
White Cheddar Grits $5: This was a good portion size for sharing as a side. In terms of grits alone, it was pretty good. My favorite grits were at Fiddlehead when they were open, but I'd order it with a side of sausage gravy. Now I like the grits at Witness in Capitol Hill which has it with bacon gravy for brunch. Basically I'm saying I need gravy to really go next level regarding my enjoyment of grits.
Overall although the food was alright, there's not much else on the current menu I feel inclined to try. I'll probably check on it now and then as I'm definitely open to giving it another shot if something catches my eye.
*****
My Star Ratings:
1 Star - Terrible. Just thinking about it makes me angry.
2 Stars - Meh. Unlikely for me to return.
3 Stars - OK. Open to coming back, but wouldn't go out of my way to.
4 Stars - Yummy! Will definitely return if I haven't already.
5 Stars - AMAZING!!! Would plan my day or even a trip around eating here.
restaurant_user_6_review: Lady Jaye is a super cute restaurant in West Seattle, and I would recommend it. Located right on California Ave, the restaurant serves for a central place to get there. a good version of Southern, casual food and BBQ. Prices were ok and not ash (maybe ranging about $11-$20 for an entree). Though their menu is not expansive, there are a couple of things we tried that were flavorful and just the right amount of saltiness (such as the garlic shrimp and beef cheeks). Also, Customer service-wise, the waitress was very nice and would consider coming back.
restaurant_user_7_review:
Came for brunch. Food was not bad. Service was excellent though.
Food: I went for the basic breakfast... pretty sure that's the name. It came with two eggs, crispy bacon, home fries and a biscuit. The dish literally came out within 5 minutes of ordering. Not sure if this was impressive or concerning... BUT the food was tasty. There were 4 slices of bacon - a ton! The home fries were just okay... they were kind of mushy and I usually like my potatoes crispy. The biscuit, while good, was not the best I've ever had. It was a good texture but lacking flavor even when paired with butter and jam.
Service: we were promptly greeted and seated when my husband and i strolled in at 11am on a Sunday. The service was very warm, friendly and attentive. This restaurant has only been open for four months so I can only hope they sustain this level of service for years to come.
Atmosphere: if I recall correctly there was a bar in the restaurant so wouldn't be surprised if this spot did happy hours and such. We didn't get anything to drink though for brunch. I liked the size of the restaurant - not too big, not too small. The woman who took our check mentioned they have a beautiful patio out back which is super popular during the summer, but we didn't see it in person.
Overall: good standard brunch fare, could use a bit more oomph though. Service is excellent however.
restaurant_user_8_review:
Stopped in here for Happy Hour and it was fantastic. It was a little chilly outside, but not raining so we opted to sit outside by their huge fire pit.
Our server came out pretty quick after seating us and we ordered a couple of whiskey warm drinks. They were delicious. Their HH menu is pretty good too. We had a variety of items to try.
Food is good, service is good, however, it was a little pricey because we ordered drinks that weren't on the HH menu. Overall, a definite must go back to!
restaurant_user_9_review: Cute little bar tucked on California Ave. Great space to catch up with friends or grab a drink. I've only been for dinner on a Friday night and it was a good vibe. Ordered a local beer and the chicken wangs with a side of mac & cheese. All of which was a really delicious pairing. My friend ordered the turkey leg which was huge! - the meat fell off the bone nicely, similar to having it be sous vide. The bar has many options to choose from and the menu was simple yet promising. Customer service was great and engaging, not too bothersome or not enough, just right! This place definitely prides themselves in quality (food, service, aesthetics) without being too overbearing. Brunch looks like it would taste good. Will definitely come back again!
restaurant_user_10_review:
Nice little spot off California Ave with Ron Swanson on the TVs lol. I ordered 3 dishes. the mushroom dip with chips, the pork cheek Mac and cheese and the pork collar pastrami plate .
Mushroom dip - very flavorful, big fan
Mac and cheese - pork cheek is amazing, super tender and my favorite part of the entire meal, the Mac and cheese was really creamy how I like it but a little salty
Pastrami plate - the pastrami was really good, also very tender, they really pay attention to the details when it comes to their meats
Drinks - Japanese vesper was on special, incredibly smooth and had the faint taste of a stick of juicy fruit gum, loved it.
Over all good experience here, only reason it's not a 5 is, it was pretty pricey. An app, 2 entrees and a couple drinks were $100+ but that's Seattle for ya
restaurant_user_11_review:
Went here on New Year's Day for brunch. We have been wanting to try this place for a while. The place was packed! The staff was really friendly. We both had coffee and tried their fresh orange juice. Both were delicious. This was the first fresh squeezed orange juice that actually tasted like it was fresh!
I had the chorizo scramble and my husband had the breakfast sandwich. Both were so good! The chorizo tasted so fresh and perfectly spiced. The sandwich had deliciously smoked Canadian bacon on it.
I am so happy we just checked this place out. I can't wait to come back for dinner and another brunch! Love having this great place in west seattle!
restaurant_user_12_review: A nice bar in west seatttle. The drinks are amazing but the food is okay. Where do we start. We ordered the buffalo trails, eagle rare version of scotch and the bourbon crusta. Each of these drinks were mind blowingly delicious. They do have a full sized bar with a lot of rare or hard to find liqour as well. We ordered the chicken wings and were not impressed with it. Loads of seating, staff is friendly, service is great. Highly recommend to stop by for drinks.
restaurant_user_13_review:
The food was absolutely delicious! I cannot remember the servers name, unfortunately, but she was an absolute delight! Kind and patient, she let us explore the menu and offered suggestions when appropriate.
I got the mac and cheese, which was orgasmic. I didn't bother taking a breath between bites!
Our server suggested the lava cake with peanut butter ice cream for dessert. HOLY MOLY. Absolute perfection
restaurant_user_14_review:
I heard lots of good things about this place and had a friend visiting the day they were offering their first brunch. I figured that would be a perfect day to check them out!
The ambience was nice - could be good for a date or just with friends. They were playing some great bluegrass music, which I definitely appreciated. Our waiter was really friendly and checked on us appropriately.
The menu was limited. I had a hard time choosing something off the menu, which is normally a good problem to have, but in this case, it was because nothing really stood out.
Ended up choosing the chorizo scramble with a jalape√±o crema and potatoes. The scramble was meh. The chorizo wasn't really the chorizo I was expecting (i'm thinking red and spicy - this was grey and mild). Wasn't very flavorful overall. I think I could've made a better scramble at home to be honest. The potatoes were really good, though! My friends all raved about their potatoes. No one really said anything about their actual meal. The potatoes were salty and perfectly crispy.
I got a bloody mary which was clearly spiced and seasoned. Just the way I like it. My friend got the smoked pineapple mimosa which was very interesting! It didn't taste smoked at first but got smokier and smokier as she got to the bottom, until it was too smoky. Not sure if it wasn't mixed well or something. Ill give that a pass though since it was interesting!
Overall, the food was meh (again, only reviewing brunch). I would like to come back to review their dinner options because I've heard such great things (but I also saw reviews saying not to believe the hype, so who knows). I could also come back just for drinks!
restaurant_user_15_review: I went to Lady Jaye on a Sunday morning for their brunch. I had heard about this restaurant from word of mouth and I wanted to try it out. I was greeted warmly by Mona who quickly got me a menu. I decided to order the shrimp and grits. i have not found good shrimp and grits in Seattle. I've had amazing shrimp and grits in the South in places like New Orleans and Atlanta. However, the grits I've tried in Seattle taste like cement. When I received my plate, I was surprised by the arugula on top of the shrimp grits. It was definitely a Pacific Northwest twist on the dish. I loved that the arugula had a pleasant vinaigrette on it. The actual grits were the right texture and immersed with chunks of Andouille sausages that gave it great flavor. The shrimp was cooked perfectly and mixed well with the creamy grits. This was definitely the best shrimp and grits I've had in Seattle and anywhere outside of the South. As I was leaving, the place started filling up. It has a good vibe to it with friendly staff. I would highly recommend Lady Jaye with their Pacific Northwest twist on American comfort food. It's definitely a gem in the Junction in West Seattle. I never go to West Seattle but I would go out of my way to come out here again for Lady Jaye.
restaurant_user_16_review:
I went to Lady Jaye a couple weeks ago for dinner with some friends, and had a good experience. I didn't order any cocktails -which they are known for- so that was a bit of a mistake. The food overall was good, nothing really blew me away though, that said, we only tried a few of the menu items.
I'm planning on going back and trying a cocktail (or two) in the near future
restaurant_user_17_review: Finally, a great cocktail place in West Seattle Junction! Right in the heart of Alaska Junction, a really cool place for cocktails and dinner. I really enjoyed the service, food and cocktails. My only recommendation would be to change music: it might be personal but I would tone it down. Otherwise, a great place with a cool vibe and delicious cocktails.
restaurant_user_18_review:
After 20 years, Lady Jayes has knocked Jaks grill off the top of my favorite restaurant list.
It's hard to settle on one dish to review but the burrata is definitely my favorite even though I was skeptical at first. Hot beans with cold cheese? No thanks! BUT oh my gosh! After the first bite of creamy salty goodness, it's yes please!! Then there's the pork cakes and the mushroom dip with house made chips!! Soooo deelishus.
I'm not usually a fan of crazy cocktails but I love have they pull together a bunch of interesting ingredients and make it work. I have to have a Strawberry Manilow every time I go.
I love the ambiance. The lighting, decor and music make it a place I could hang out all day. It's so comfortable and welcoming.
The staff are hands down my favorite part. They are so excited about their product and even more excited to share it with you and it shows. Everyone I have talked to has been so gracious and humble.
I look forward to every time I get to go. Hmmmm maybe brunch on Sunday???
restaurant_user_19_review:
Holy cow, the pork pastrami plate. How could brisket or a Reuben get any more delicious? Corned pork. So rich and fatty and flavorful. Served on a beautiful cutting board with onion rye, stone ground mustard, a pickle, and house-made sauerkraut. I loved the concept of assembling your own open-faced reubens - ensures nothing gets soggy and each bite has the perfect mix of flavors.
Next time, I want to try the giant turkey let with Mexican fixings (ancho bbq sauce, lime crema, cilantro, etc.) - looked pretty delicious.
restaurant_user_20_review:
Oh my god, this place was good. I can't think of one thing I would change. We got in around 4 on a Saturday and it was happy hour (yay!) some of their signature cocktails were 2 dollars off and they had food deals. I opted for a Guns and Rosemary gin cocktail and it was delicious! It came with a salted rosemary rim and I was pleasantly surprised that it was not overpowered by the rosemary and it was just the right amount of sweet. I had two of these babies it was too good to switch to something different.
Whoo, okay distracted by how good that cocktail was. Let's talk ambiance. It's a little dim lit but basically the perfect amount to be relaxed. Just being there made me feel cool, it's a little rustic, a little hip, they have a huge chalkboard with the specials written out. What more can you ask for? We were there for a date night and this delivered for a date night mood for sure.
Service was awesome! Our waitress was the perfect amount of attentive while also letting us enjoy our food, drinks and each others company. We never had anything we didn't need and when I annoyingly decided I wanted oysters after we ordered everything else 5 minutes before she was very nice about.
And finally the food! I want to eat here every day. We had 4 oysters on the half shell with a tobasco ice topping that comes on the side. The tobasco Ice wasn't overwhelming and you could still taste the flavor of the oyster. We also had the pork cheek Mac and cheese and pork collar pastrami platter. I was a little hesitant when I saw the mac and cheese had arugula on it but it was heaven. All of the flavors went so well together, now I'm wondering if I should put arugula on my Mac and cheese more often. The pastrami plate was also amazing. It was the fanciest deconstructed rueben I've ever had. The meat was smoky and juicy served with delicious crispy toast, thousand island dressing, mustard, pickles and sauerkraut.
We will be back to try the bologna sandwich.

restaurant_user_1_review:
I want to start by saying that there is a God in Heaven, I am not being blasphemous (maybe just a little light hearted) because I prayed that I might find good Tacos (and other delicious Mexican dishes) in Seattle and had all but given up hope!! And then, the skies opened up, the clouds cleared, and the sun shined down on Sazon Kitchen in Ballard and there was rejoicing, seriously, I was rejoicing!!!!
I drive by here everyday, every, single, day and I did not realize that this was a Mexican food joint until one evening I noticed the word, TACO on the side of a trailer outside the building. I immediately did an illegal U-Turn and turned right onto incoming traffic (no one was hurt completing this maneuver) and a ran up and placed my order.
I ordered five Tacos, three Carne Asada and two Carnitas and let me just say that when I saw them I knew they were going to be good!!!
These Tacos were made perfectly, Corn Shells topped with Meat that was tender and flavorful, covered with Onions, Cilantro, and just a touch of Diced Tomatoes, perfect!!!
I have been in Seattle for eight months and Sazon Kitchen served me the absolute best Tacos, hands down, nobody else is even in a close second, that I have had in a very long time and I now have a go to Mexican Restaurant that I will be visiting often!!!
The Service was wonderful, the food was fresh and delicious, the restaurant was clean with a very inviting feel to it and the price was perfectly reasonable ...... CAN'T ..... WAIT ..... TO ....... GO ......... BACK!!!!
There are so many other things on the menu that I am looking forward to trying!!
Until next time my fellow Yelpers ..... Be Local ...... Live Local ..... and whenever possible ..... BUY LOCAL!!!!!
restaurant_user_2_review:
First timer here! Super cool they have a restaurant and a taco truck on the lot too. Cool feel to this place and there was parking in front.
I got the machaca de res with verde chilaquiles to go.
The potatoes were not cooked through- legit hard pieces and dried out. No flavor, disappointing.
I was in front when I called for pick up so there was no time waiting for the food so WHY were my avocados black??
Not enough verde sauce on the chilaquiles.
The best part was obviously the meat but it was lacking flavor as well.
For a $20 plate, I better be enjoying my meal and this was subpar.
restaurant_user_3_review:
This is a hidden gem! I first found this place when my friends posted about it on the good ol' IG stories. I love Chilaquiles and immediately tried this place out the next day.
The pros:
Great portions and speedy service. You walk up to the counter to order here and bus your own dishes, so it's a very casual environment (which I like!). I've tried the Dicorciados Eggs (one of their chilaquiles based dishes) and also their signature dish, the Machacha de Res (shredded beef, potatoes, chilaquiles, eggs, tortilla, beans... YUM!!). Both are excellent! The Machacha de Res is splittable between two people if you're not SUPER hungry, otherwise, you will probably have some leftovers.
The cons:
Could have a bit more indoor seating, although the outdoor seating is heated and that helps.
restaurant_user_4_review:
Mexican breakfast, heck yes!
We came here after enjoying the Ballard Farmer's Market and was pleasantly surprised by our choices. I enjoyed the fact that we ordered our food inside -very laid back. Also, a little confused as to where the Mediterranean description fits into the menu, I only saw one item that was Mediterranean - toast.
The trick is to go for the Machaca de Res and something sweet like the French Toast. It comes out as a massive entree, which I had to share with my family. The beans were perfect and the cheese wasn't what I expected it had a squash-like texture and flavor. The meat was so tender and paired well with the rest of the meal, like the eggs and the tortilla chips. My mother got the french toast which was excellent as well, could've done with more syrup but it came with some sort of vanilla pudding with fruit pieces, which I know adds moisture to the dish. Everything was fresh but could've used a dash or two of salt and spices which leaves it at a 4 star experience.
restaurant_user_5_review: First time here and the food was excellent. I had the Signature Machaca de Res and press pot coffee. The perfect morning!
restaurant_user_6_review:
I think I found my new favorite brunch spot. Sazon's is order at the front, and they'll bring the food to your table.
We sat on the patio with our friend's pup, and got our food very quickly after. The machaca de res plate is AMAZING and absolutely enormous - it had beans, potatoes, 2 eggs, chilaquiles with avocado, the machaca itself, and then 3 big tortillas (probably 6")! The tortillas are amazing. I barely ate half of this entire plate. My friend demolished his plate.
My boyfriend's egg sandwich had super fluffy, amazing scrambled eggs, beans, and perfectly crisp bacon all on a soft but crispy on the outside bun. It was unreal. The side potatoes were really crispy and flavorful.
Total for 2 machaca dishes + 1 egg sandwich + a Mexican coke + a coffee = ~$50. Service was super lovely and friendly.
restaurant_user_7_review:
I love this place. I keep trying to figure out other ways to say it, but there it is. We have had delightful breakfasts here and go *often*. I like the grain bowl, the shrimp omelette (the best!), a couple of dishes that are named but those names escape me at the moment... but they're all great. All of the people working behind the counters are kind to us and food comes out quickly.
The hot sauce is inspired, as I think it's prepared the same way you would for Chinese chili oil, but smoky and (also) delicious.
restaurant_user_8_review:
Great food and friendly service, what else could you ask for?
For years I didn't like "mexican" food, that was until I went to Mexico and tried the real stuff, which not many places in the US seem to go for. Sazon though is a great example of how to do mexican food right. Their menu is original and so well executed. They have an excellent variety of breakfast and brunch dishes, and now they even serve mimosas.
The restaurant is very casual, and you have to order at the counter, but they are very quick at bringing things out. Also, they have wifi and are dog friendly. What else could you ask for?
restaurant_user_9_review:
As my friend and I were looking through the menu about to order, we also couldn't help but notice the line outside Un Bien, home of arguably the best sandwiches in Seattle. We were like should we go to Un Bien instead? Then we rationalized by saying, Sazon has so many 5-star reviews! And this patio is cute on this sunny day. Let's just stay. I should have just acted on my instinct in this case.
The food at Sazon tasted fresh and good, but it was definitively, nothing special. I wanted to get the shrimp omelette but they were out of shrimp so substituted with steak instead. My friend got the shredded beef (machaca de res). Maybe because this is breakfast food, but I was not really impressed with the flavors. My steak was a bit dry, and the omelette was too firm if you know what I mean. The refried beans were fantastic, even though I don't usually like them. Potatoes were a snooze.
The people running the business seemed genuinely nice, but I don't think I will return even if I am in the neighborhood. Maybe I will try the taco truck next time. The free coffee with check-in was nice, tho.
restaurant_user_10_review:
Food : I ordered Macha De Res as carry out . Tasted real good with the serving size as per the price paid . The food portion is filling for sure . No complains on the taste or quality .
Ambience : This place opened up 3 mo this ago and gets busy for breakfast and weekends . I wish they are open for longer. Very well Maintained and nicely organized outdoor seating vs indoor tables.
Service : The people are responsive and they recognize if someone visiting more than once unlike most of the restaurants in this neighborhood .
Hopefully they keep up this personal rapport for longer .
restaurant_user_11_review:
Fresh ingredients, great service, loads of unique menu offerings and lovely ambience. We have needed a good Mexican place in seattle for a very long time and this spot delivers the goods!
Comparing this spot against other the more authentic mexican spots like el camion, la carta oxaca and fonda la catrina. This place is in between the two- more trendy than fonda and more upscale or hipster than el camion. They also have the taco food truck parked outside on weekends which i plan to try soon.
Now for the food- there are so many options. We asked the guy at the counter for recommendations and settled on the Divorciados eggs( eggs with chilaquiles, red and green salsa, crema , beans, avocado) for the vegetarian( with eggs) and the Arrachera and eggs (asada, eggs, chorizo, chilaquiles, greens, bread, beans) for the hard core meat eater.
We rounded it off with theo blend coffee which was free for first time visitors with yelp checkin, and the freshly squeezed orange juice. It is rare to find a spot with great service, menu and ingredients.
The chorizo was probably the best tasting - though everything was very good. Meat portions were small but the entire dish was more than filling and a huge serving. Definitely recommend and would take friends to this new spot next time!
restaurant_user_12_review:
40 minutes. That's the wait time from when I ordered, and when my wife and I received our meal. Somewhere inside the timeframe, our first cup of coffee didn't arrive until my wife went to the counter, then I went to the counter, and then after waiting a few minutes longer, we finally got coffee. I'd say it took 15 minutes after I ordered, and two reminders we ordered coffee, that we got coffee. Let's also explore the scenerio when it came to our flatware.
For a place that makes you get your own flatware, they didn't have any forks available for the first 20 minutes in the trays. It didn't matter so much, since our food took twice as long to get, but I cold clearly see other folks going to the trays, seeing them empty, then looking like, "Well darn, how am I suppose to eat my meal with a steak knife?"
Also, let's also examine the scenario that the table got their flatware delivered to them... weird... also they were two fairly attractive young females (20s), and one of the servers (young male) decided they should have their flatware delivered to them.. this was before they refilled the tray for all the other customers... and he was definitely flirting them them (trying.. to anyway).
Also, let's talk portions. When were finally presented our food, I had ordered Arrachera & Eggs.. which is Skirt steak marinated, accompanied with eggs. To be clear, the menu mentions "Asada & Mexican Sausage".. which the steak was obvious (not tender but on the plate).. the sausage was basically missing. What was provided was about a single spoon full worth of sausage.
Overall, it wasn't a very good experience. Yes, it was a busy day, and I'm sure there was a confluence of things to get this particular experience, but it happened. Unfortunately what was going to be an exciting experience trying a new local restaurant, wasn't.
restaurant_user_13_review: Love the vibe of this place! Order up front and grab a seat. The food took awhile but it was worth it since it seemed that they made everything from scratch. Huge portions, a lot of options, friendly staff. While crowded wasn't annoyingly crowded. Such a great spot for brunch. Option to sit outside too if you can grab a seat. If you check in on yelp, you get a free cup of coffee!
restaurant_user_14_review: Great little stop for a tasty breakfast. The Mediterranean toast was delicious. Topped with two over easy eggs to make the perfect gooey brunch. The humans and feta atop the cheese made it enough for a meal.
restaurant_user_15_review:
Surprisingly those 5 stars reviews are legit!
Small cozy place, super friendly service, fun music and atmosphere and most importantly delicious food!
Generous portions too!
Not your typical Mexican place here in Seattle.
Definitely worth stopping by.
Trust me, I know food.
restaurant_user_16_review:
This is a 3.5 star review. Their taco truck gets 4 stars and the restaurant gets 3
Pros
- excellent service and friendly staff
- nice cafe setup
- Amazing tacos
Cons
- I ordered the chiliquiles and added some chicken.
It was ok. The chicken was tasty but having lived in CA and eaten a lot of Mexican food...it wasn't en par with what someone would have there
restaurant_user_17_review: Gets very busy on a weekend around 9:30-10 am! Saz√≥n has outdoor seating so it was great to bring our small dog. The staff are friendly and helpful. I ordered the chilaquiles but didn't read the description- they don't come with an egg and I found it pretty bland without the egg. The staffperson told me that the divorciados is a similar Option that comes with an egg. My dad ordered the breakfast sandwich and that was good.
restaurant_user_18_review: The menu is very interesting it was hard to decide because everything sounded so good. I got the Machaca de Res and it was a little greasy but very good. I really liked the coffee too. They have a very small parking lot but I was able to park on the street. There is a great patio to sit at in the shade.
restaurant_user_19_review:
Such a great new spot!
I knew the food was going to be good from these reviews--I didn't expect the dining experience to be so nice though. The patio is lovely on a sunny day, and the presentation of the food is really elegant. The food itself is delicious. From the oatmeal to Rosita's eggs to the Machaca de res... everything was amazing. Also, the portions are BIG.
I am so happy Sazon Kitchen is here. Between it, Un Bien, and Watson's Counter, 15th is becoming the place to eat!
restaurant_user_20_review:
Finally made time for breakfast at Sazon Kitchen and was quite pleased. Can recommend the Huevos Divorciados and the Mollettes. I certainly expect to go back and try more dishes! The way the staff interacted with one another seemed to indicate Sazon is a happy place. They were very friendly and helpful with us, explaining what different menu items are.
The coffee is strooong, thank goodness there's water to mellow it out. However, there's only powdered coffee creamer. Help I need a little half & half. UPDATE, UPDATE: they have half & half in the fridge, just ask :)
This place is worth a trip.

restaurant_user_1_review:
OMG, this place was charming! I came here with two others for a mid-workday lunch on a Friday. The place was empty at lunch, but I hear that's not the case for dinner.
We were welcomed by our server, who was attentive, friendly, and genuinely seemed to love his job. The restaurant is small, but it's warm and inviting. I felt like I was transferred back to somewhere in Italy.
The server took time to learn our wine interests and made recommendations, bringing out several for us to taste. We ordered our food and it arrived quickly. The menu is fairly traditional (meaning it's light on the meat options).
I ordered the risotto and WOW was it good. My mouth is watering just thinking about it....
Between the food, service, atmosphere, and good wine... I will surely be back.
restaurant_user_2_review:
I don't know what happened last night, but we'll never be back. Had an 8pm reservation. After being seated nothing happened. No one said a word to us. No quick hello. No drink order. No "be right with you". Sat there until 8:15, and this place isn't that big. I know 15 minutes doesn't sound like a long time but when you are just sitting there in a tiny room, believe me, it is. Started to get worried that no one around us had food. When I thought a server was finally coming to us she stopped at a table next to us that had been seated at least 30 minutes and asked if they were ready to order. Nope. We had a show to go to and this almost hijacked the whole evening. We left.
By the way, quick note, take this as you will. A young poorly dressed couple came in when we were waiting. Like, girl was wearing a Rugrats T-shirt. They looked scruffy but seemed like a nice couple looking for a date night. They asked if there was a table available and the girl said no, fully booked all night. Literally a minute later a better dressed older couple comes in, asks same question, gets told there's a 20 minute wait. My wife and I were like "hmm, that just happened". I imagine some might like they do this, protecting their otherwise nice ambiance, but watching it happen was off-putting to us.
restaurant_user_3_review:
I firmly believe this is one of the best Italian, well Sicilian restaurants in town! Everything on the menu is goooood. We got sardine pasta and tonight's special scallop spicy tomato sauce linguini. AMAZING.
Then we had Panna cotta and tiramisu for dessert. Such a lovely place. Perfect for dates and important anniversaries.
restaurant_user_4_review: La Fontana Siciliana is the best restaurant I've ever been to! The staff was so welcoming and friendly. They all went above and beyond for my boyfriend and I while we dined. Our server, Ray, was very kind and attentive. We were from out of town and he gave us great recommendations on what to order as well as other things to do around Seattle. The owner, Mario, served us our food as well as dessert. My boyfriend ordered Chicken Marsala with pasta and I ordered the Fettuccini Ai Funghi. Both dishes were incredible. We got a cannoli and tiramisu for dessert, and both were phenomenal. I can't recommend this restaurant enough! It is a must.
restaurant_user_5_review:
My husband had been wanting to take me here for years, but I could never find anything on their menu (online viewing) that I thought I would enjoy.
We came in on New Years eve, without a reservation. After waiting about 5 minutes, we were seated at a cozy table in the corner.
We started with the arugula salad and soup of the evening, which was a white squash soup..super tasty.
As our main entree, we ordered their two specials. One was lobster fettuccini and the other was Osso Bucco with risotto! OGM..both were outstanding!!
We brought our own bottle of wine, but each enjoyed a delicious glass of champagne while our wine was breathing:)
Our server was great. The only thing I didn't like was the complementary bread...not my style...but everything else was AWSOME!
Can't wait to return!
restaurant_user_6_review:
Great little hole in the wall. If you want a near Italy-like experience, eat outside. The tree canopy and surrounding apartment complexes add to the experience as if you're actually in Italy. The service was excellent. Waiters and owner herself checked on our table frequently to make sure the food and experience was high in quality to which it was. You must go for the black linguine and smoked salmon. One thing that prevents this place from being a perfect 10 for me is that the surrounding area is full of questionable people. One example was a man who was offering free blowjobs. But being a great little hole in the wall, it really takes you away from all that noise even if the free blowjobs were waiting for you outside.
Food: 9/10
Dining experience: 9/10
Overall: 9/10
restaurant_user_7_review:
My boyfriend and I went here during a short weekend trip to Seattle so I can't say of it's the best Italian restaurant in town, but I have a hard time imaging what they could do better. Our server, Ray, was attentive and friendly. He seemed to genuinely like his job and even took time to talk to us about Seattle and give us some tips on places to check out.
The restaurant is definitely a small hole in the wall but the decor is nice and the tables were cozy without being cramped.
We started with the calamari which is served in an amazing pesto sauce. I had their fettuccine ai funghi. If you like mushrooms I'd definitely recommend it. My boyfriend ordered the tortellini in a meat sauce. It was yummy and super unique.
restaurant_user_8_review: This place is the perfect romantic date spot, although, for my first visit, I took my children. It has been open for 25 years. They have a piano player on Saturday nights who has been playing there for all 25 years. Apparently, the menu hasn't changed, either. I had mushroom risotto, which was delicious, and my daughter had cheese ravioli, also delicious. My son said it was the best cheesecake he's ever had in all 8 years of his life.
restaurant_user_9_review:
Note: I would say the restaurant is more of $$$ than $$ as your price per entree will likely be over $30 a person if you're going for the more decent dishes but not surprising as it seems like the spot is made for ambiance.
We got the bruschetta to start and two glasses of red wine. The bruschetta had a bit too much garlic and wasn't easy to eat as the bread is tough. Flavor-wise it wasn't bad but I don't know if strong garlic breath is what I wanted after this dinner.
For main entrees, we got the Risotto ai Funghi and a squid ink pasta topped with calamari and a few prawns. The risotto was the most expensive bowl of rice I have eaten. I did enjoy the flavor of the risotto though and it definitely is rich. However, I don't think it looked great so... presentation was a bit lacking. The squid ink pasta itself was mediocre at best. "Meh" was my thought after taking a few bites.
I did like the fact that they brought out a tray and explained the desserts before we decided on one. The tiramisu was a bit overly sweet and lacked more coffee notes.
Towards the end, I could see many tables start to leave while we did not get the check. We finished around 9 PM and stood up around 10 PM to walk up to the counter. It was only then that the wait staff asked us if we were ready to check out. Places like pho restaurants do that because service is not really a thing there. For a restaurant of this caliber, that can be pretty unacceptable and it made me uncomfortable as I did not want to flag someone down.
Overall not very impressed with the food portions or quality. Even though the spot was cute, my partner and I don't think we'd come back unfortunately as we've had much better for a more reasonable price in the area and more attentive service.
restaurant_user_10_review:
Absolutely amazing! Food was perfection, staff was so genuinely friendly and accomodating. Hostess was so sweet and Mario was the best server we could ask for. Perfect place for a nice night out.
Thank you guys for such a great night!
restaurant_user_11_review:
Fantastic food! Quaint little Italian place. Family of four and every dish was incredible; even the plain old cheese ravioli - has a perfect sauce that takes it to the next level. Not a white table cloth, upscale place but that makes it feel better; like Itialy, you feel
loke you could get a bottle of vino and just eat for 45 mins on the amazing food while chatting with friends (or strangers at the next table). Wine pours were very generous and while it wasn't a typical name brand wine list the wines were very good. Outdoor seating wasn't available but I could envision amazing ambience if it were. Wait staff was very helpful with my teenagers that asked lots of questions, I felt like they wanted you to have a great experience.
Will be back for sure.
restaurant_user_12_review: On a rainy day in Seattle, my husband and I who are Canadian stumbled onto this place. We actually only picked it because it was quasi close to our hotel and we didn't want to be stumbling around in the dark, in the rain. We were glad we did. Really sweet and romantic place. Charming, with a intimate setting for a date night. Loved the chandelier. Our server was kind and quick, answering our questions about the menu and giving suggestions. Really great server. I decided on the home made linguini with smoked salmon in a lemon cream sauce. My husband ordered the spicy sausage penne with a tomato based sauce. I also ordered a glass of wine. I have to say, with the low prices to high quality wine in the stores, I was disappointed with the price per glass of wine. And no half liter house wine specials. This should be a given in a Italian restaurant. Prices were slightly high but in the acceptable range of what we were generally eating in Seattle. Definitely my pasta was the winner. Delicious springy noodles in a rich creamy lemony sauce with generous portions of salmon. My husbands pasta was pleasant enough and generous enough, but the home made noodles made my dish shine. Definitely worth a check if you are wanting a romantic date night.
restaurant_user_13_review: This place is awesome, everyone loved what they ordered and didn't think the price was that high for Seattle, if anything the waiter was clumsy at times (maybe first day?), But nothing a good meal can't fix, will definitely keep going more
restaurant_user_14_review:
Amazing food, incredible service. Treated like family. Best ravioli I've had. Server Ray is awesome, honestly above and beyond service - knows the menu and all of his recommendations were on point.
Thanks to everyone for making this a memorable night with great friends and fantastic food!
Cheers!
restaurant_user_15_review: Delicious. Generous. Timely. This place delivered on all accounts. I went with two friends and none of us left disappointed. The service was friendly and quick. We were able to sit outside because of the good weather. I ordered risotto and it was so rich and delicious. I can't complain at all.
restaurant_user_16_review:
Had high hopes because almost everything we tried in Seattle was good, but La Fontana Siciliana was just standard Italian for my liking. The outside area was super cute/beautiful for date night. They have tables surrounding a pretty fountain right next to the entrance of the restaurant. The interior is also very intimate and tiny. My seat was pretty uncomfortable because I was so close to the table behind me...
The food was good but nothing stood out where I wanted to come back. We ordered the Fettuccine ai Funghi and the Fettuccine del Bosco. The serving size was also pretty small compared to most other Italian places I've been to. Normally I will have to always take at least half of my pasta dish to go but this place made me feel like I needed to order more after my meal... The service was pretty slow and the waiter barely checked up on us. Food 3/5, Service 3/5. There seems to be a lot of other Italian places nearby. If you are visting Seattle like I was, I would recommend going to try somewhere else.
restaurant_user_17_review:
My husband and I brought my cousin who's visiting from out of town.
The restaurant is super intimate and radiates a rustic, authentic Italian restaurant. The space is small and the decor is of neutral stucco, with purposeful cracks in the walls that added to the old world Italy feel.
They have a piano, and at the the time we were there, they had a pianist playing. This is a very romantic space. You would not know this restaurant is located in Belltown because it's hidden behind tall gates where It appears that there is only a water feature. The restaurant is off to the side within the little courtyard.
We did enjoy the food. But it wasn't so super delicious that I will crave the meal again. Service was slow and unconventional particularly with the wine. They opened a bottle and put it on the table without asking anyone to taste it first. They didn't keep our water glasses refilled so we shared our water.
3 stars for the lovely atmosphere, good meal, slow and not up to par service staff for this type of restaurant.
restaurant_user_18_review:
In the pantheon of Italian restaurants in Seattle, this gem, just a stone's throw from Pike Place Market, is often overlooked and under-rated.
La Fontana Siciliana is a great example of understated elegance, from cooking to serving to the atmosphere of the place itself. Here you'll find true Old World Italian cuisine served by an impeccable waitstaff in a place with warm ambiance that is both comforting and elevating at the same time.
Pasta dishes are excellent, as are their entrees. Some highlights: Fettucine ai Funghi, Fettucini del Bosco, Pasta con le Sarde, and Pollo Marsala. Their risottos are also excellent.
La Fontana Siciliana is ideal for romantic casual dining, spending quality time with good friends, or before/after a concert or movie close by. Highly recommended for the cuisine, the service, and the atmosphere.
restaurant_user_19_review: Incredible experience. It seems this is one of the only more traditional Italian restaurants in downtown Seattle, which as a visitor without a car, I didn't want to go outside downtown. The atmosphere was romantic and wonderful. It's a small little restaurant so I'd imagine you'll need a reservation on a Friday and Saturday night. We had the soup of the day, a butternut squash bisque, and the garlic bread to start. The soup was to die for and was topped off with a great parmesan cheese and olive oil. Wonderful pairings. The garlic bread was delicious and great for dipping into the soup. We ordered veal and two pastas for our entrees and not a single plate had anything left on it after. Highly recommend the veal cannelloni which was the star of the night. Portions are of good size, so good that we couldn't even consider desert as we were full with delicious italian carbs.
restaurant_user_20_review: Rainy Monday nite, wander around per Yelp 4* recommendation. The place indeed felt like in Italy with the gentlemen talking loudly and singing around the room. Don't change a thing, it's awesome! Had a couple glass of delicious Scilian red accompanied by squid ink scallops risotto. There was a hint of sour in the pallet, could be the lemon or something, overall it was fantastic. Great homy Italian

restaurant_user_1_review:
Beautiful place with great food and execution! Cantinetta is a charming little place in Wallingford, which has managed to keep its character over the years.
Went here on a Saturday evening, and thoroughly enjoyed our experience, everything from the decor to service to the food.
The restaurant is beautifully designed, and gives a classy vibe. The ambiance is dark, but could get a little noisy on busy weekend nights.However, it's a perfect place for an intimate date night!
Though the place is pretty large, its popularity keeps it pretty packed, and I wouldn't recommend heading there on weekends without reservations. When we went, every seat was occupied, with more diners waiting to be seated.
Our group got a good variety of food, almost all of which was great. The arancini appetizer was perfectly made, and the focaccia was the best!
Among the pastas, we were blown away by the risotto, but I felt that the tagliatelle was very heavily salted, and didn't enjoy it as much as the other food.
The zeppole was really well made as well, a perfect way to end a meal.
They also have an amazing wine list, and we split a few bottles, all of which were great.
The service was pretty good too. It did get a little slow but with a packed house, that is expected. Our server kept checking on us pretty often, and they had a few other people refilling beverages which helped.
The prices are as expected for a place of this caliber, a little higher than the neighborhood pasta-place. But with the quality of food and service without the pretentiousness, it's completely justifiable.
This is a must go place in Seattle, especially for celebratory night outs or simply date nights. Definitely recommend!
restaurant_user_2_review:
I think this was my third time there, but I never wrote a review before now.
We arrived a bit early and sat at the bar and had a cocktail while waiting for our table to be ready. The bartender was very busy, but kept checking on us.
Our reservation time came and went, but the hostess kept us informed about what was going on. (The party before us was just taking their time after dinner) No problem, we weren't in a rush.
We got to our table and were introduced to our server Katie. She was great! Very fun, and knowledgeable about the menu.
I was torn between the cacio e pepe tagliatelle and the truffle risotto, and asked if I could get a half order of each. She said they don't do that, but spoke with the chef and was able to put some truffle on the cacio e cepe. It was actually a really good combination!
For dessert, my wife and I split an order of zeppole. 4 balls of warm, gooey, sugary goodness. Two with pistachio sauce, and two with nutella sauce.
We joked that the zeppole was the only reason we were there, but everything we had was excellent.
Cantinetta is part of our regular restaurant rotation!
restaurant_user_3_review:
Such a cute place!
Our bartender was the best! He asked if we've been here before, and when we said no, it was our first time, he automated listed off recommendations from the dinner menu! We ordered all of his suggestions, and they all exceeded expectations! The pork belly was one of the best I've ever had. The gnocchi was soft and pillowy, so delicious and flavorful!
Definitely recommend if you're in the Wallingford area, and looking for a great Italian restaurant with lots of ambiance and excellent service!
restaurant_user_4_review:
Very good Italian food in Wallingford (though there are also locations in Bellevue and I think Madison Park). I ordered the tagliatelle cacio e pepe as my main dish, and I LOVED the noodles. They were chewy, heavy, fresh. I wish there had been a bit more cacio and a bit more pepe on top of them, but the thin sauce allowed the very high quality noodle to shine through. The egg yolk was great to moisten the noodles, too.
The other star of the show was the focaccia our waiter brought to the table while we were waiting for our salads (literally just greens and a vinaigrette, I would rather save the $9 next time). It was like eating a cloud made out of bread! Marvelous texture, salty enough, and amazing olive oil to dip in.
Extensive wine list featuring wines from both Washington and Italy.
This is a good restaurant to come to for a long dinner with friends you haven't seen in a while. We didn't feel rushed by the staff at all, even when the rest of the restaurant filled up with guests. Our waiter was a little odd, but overall the service was good and unobtrusive. I'd recommend ordering one of their delicious pasta dishes as a main course since the second course options were very limited. And flip to the back page of the menu for a chuckle, you'll be glad you did. :)
restaurant_user_5_review: Cantinetta is that perfect neighborhood restaurant that you wish was one block from your house. Tonight, they celebrated New Year's Eve with a gorgeous Prix Fixe menu...and it was amaaaaazing!
restaurant_user_6_review: Love this place! We come here often before a concert at the Neptune or something at UW and have been coming for years. I have NEVER EVER been disappointed. The atmosphere is friendly always. Service is impeccable- Ryan is an outstanding waiter. My husband loves a cocktail and has never been disappointed. Now for the food starters such as the clams or burrata or dates are terrific and change with the season. Salads - even the simple mista is flavorful. Pastas always spot on...if it is your first time get the bolognese it will not disappoint.
restaurant_user_7_review:
We had a reservation for a Friday night - at around 6:30, it wasn't full yet and the host let us choose to sit outdoors! :) the host was so warm and friendly and our server was attentive, patient, and fun!
The food was AMAZING. We ordered the...
-Clams: honestly the best clams I've had yet. They were all opened, and flavor was fantastic! They give you a generous amount too!
-Focaccia: so soft and they also give you a generous amount. This came around the same time as the clams so dipping it in the sauce/juices was perfection. Really had to work to not get too full before everything else
-Bolognese: flavor was bomb! They use homemade flat wide pasta noodles - to me their pasta seemed to be on the eggier and al dente side. I LOVE wide noodles though!
-Steak: wow perfect medium rare, flavor was spot on, chew was great! Their fingerling potatoes were so cute, they had 3 halves of potatoes that were each a different shade of potato and it looked like a gradient.
Drinks were delicious and sitting outside under the shades was definitely a wonderful experience. Their indoors look so cozy as well! Food was amazing and so was their service. Definitely would come back again to try more foods!
restaurant_user_8_review:
Bon-jor-no. Find it in a primarily residential area of Wallingford. It has a intimate and rustic ambience about it- candles and low lighting with some music in the background sets the mood.
I'm not well-versed with Italian food, so the menu had a lot of items and words that weren't familiar to me. The prices are fair- for being a more upscale Italian restaurant, they seem to be expected. I had the Osso Buco- veal shank. It's tender and delicious, over a light sauce to give it more herbal taste. Also the polenta complements it well too. And, the Pappardelle alla Bolognese is a nice pasta dish. The texture has a nice bouncey chewy texture.
I came away impressed. Service is on point and was thorough in explaining the menu in comprehendible words. Fine Italian cuisine paired with wine is always a winning combination.
restaurant_user_9_review:
We went to Cantinetta on recommendation from a coworker and had a great experience! We ordered the burrata, pork belly, focaccia, tagliatelle cacio e pepe, butternut squash agnolotti, and short ribs- all of which we enjoyed. The highlights of the meal were probably the burrata and agnolotti. The focaccia is also a must try.
Sadly, we were so excited about the pasta we forgot to take a picture of the agnolotti entirely.
Overall, we really enjoyed all of the food and will probably be back!
restaurant_user_10_review: I came here with my family post graduation. We sat in an area where there was a fan right behind us and it was a little awkward, didn't know whether or we should have turned it off or leave it on. Bread was fresh and soft. Ordered lots of the appetizers. The clams were yummy and the broth that it was served in, absolutely delicious!! I even dipped the bread into it. The bolognese was decent. Dishes are more on the pricier side but it is expected.
restaurant_user_11_review:
With so much "Italian" in Seattle lately it's sometimes hard to figure out the gems from the rocks. But Cantinetta is differently a gem. Fresh ingredients, ever changing menus, phenomenal service. Fair prices.
We chose to sit outside, which got a little chilly- but they have heaters! Only complaint was the chairs on the patio are not very sturdy.
The focaccia is different than most others I've had, it's so dense and also very addicting. Both pastas were al dente and creative and decent portions. We shared the special Copper River Salmon, and now I get the hype. Served over a succotash of sorts. We loved this dish. No room for dessert- but hoping to be back soon.
Follow @theseafoodies
restaurant_user_12_review:
