The ravioli alla Bolognese was great. The ravioli were cooked perfectly and none of my ravioli were broken. The cheese filling was not watery and there was just the right amount of sauce. It may not look like a lot of food but it was filling. The veal dinner special was served with a side of ziti. The veal was definitely the best thing on the menu! The flavors were balanced perfectly with the use of spices and a bit of wine. The cooked spinach with it also added to the overall appeal of this dish.
The pasta al forno was the lasagne. It was a nice sized serving and it was great to see that it was not watery when brought to the table. The balance of mozzarella and ricotta was spot on. Both the penne alla puttanesca and the pene Bolognese had al dente pasta. The puttanesca had a hint of anchovy in the read sauce. If you like anchovies get this. The one dish I did not like was the spaghetti aglio olio & acciughe. I had one taste of it and felt it was way too fishy with an anchovy overload! None of the adults liked it but my young nephew ate all of it.
For dessert we had the tiramisu which was huge! It tasted wonderful and was very fresh! The chocolate cake with ice cream had very moist cake and it was also a nice size piece of cake. The puff pastry dessert had a nice amount of whipped cream and ice cream. It was very filling!
We also had two bottles of Arcangelo Salice Salentino which was good as was the Peroni of course. We also had espresso and black coffee.
Everything except for one dish was great. My Italian side left very satisfied! If you give this place a try tell them Jeff's Nonna sent you!
restaurant_user_19_review: Amazing, amazing Italian cuisine. Felt as though I was back in the Old Country and not in dreary Seattle. Excellent wine selection.
restaurant_user_20_review:
I am in love with this place! Everything I've ever ordered was fantastic! I especially love the saut√©ed mushrooms and chicken Gorgonzola.
It is a small place, but the food makes up for that. If you want authentic Italian food, go here! Yummm!!!

restaurant_user_1_review:
Boyfriend and I came here for my birthday after our previous reservation didn't pan out for an odd reason. Regardless, definitely not disappointed. The food was both plentiful and good, and the waitstaff were very nice about helping us pair wine with our food.
However, just be aware that the lighting is quite dim and this is not a quiet place! Most of the time we couldn't hear the background music and had to elevate our voices a little to talk. It didn't bother me so it won't really affect my rating but it may be an issue for others.
restaurant_user_2_review:
We spend a week end in Seattle at Christmas. A highlight is a dinner at a nice restaraunt that has some character to it. Our favorite place recently closed leaving us in need for a new Saturday night dinner place. Through Yelp, we decided upon il Bistro. Great find, but.....
This is a wonderful setting, at the foot of Post Alley and the Gum Wall and in a classic basement bistro setting. The ambiance was super and just what we like.
The wait staff was friendly and prompt. However the kitchen and bar seemed "behind" and so our drinks and meal took a long time (more than casual, elegant dining speed).
I had the gnocchi, my daughter the ciappino. Both very good. In fact, my daughter tried a bite of the gnocchi and said it was the best she ever had!
My wife on the other hand, had the chicken dish and was very unhappey with the chicken itself. The sauce and fagioli were very good but the chicken tastless and "an odd texture". It was not on the level of the rest of the dish or our dishes.
We will likely give il Bistro another try as we like the restaraunt, but not for the chicken dish.
restaurant_user_3_review:
When I'm on vacation I like to find "famous stuff": the lounges that the stars used to hang out in - or those places that all the locals rave about. My wife and I were thinking Il Bistro might fit the bill. It's been there for 30 years and It's located just off Post Alley. In fact the back wall is the legendary "gum wall." So we were expecting something amazing, maybe even legendary. The Yelp reviews promising an "underground gem" really fuelled our expectations too.
Based on the meal we had, I'd have to give it a rating of "meh." Certainly not worth $105 - which, with tip converts to $165 Canadian. I expect a memorable, or at least a good meal for that much.
The place was packed, and if you're looking for a quiet rendezvous you might be disappointed - especially if you want to whisper sweet nothings into someone's ear. While it's dimly lit (i.e. you can't read the menu without the decorative candle), cozy (low ceilings) It's louder than a Jr. High classroom the day before the school dance. We actually moved tables trying to escape the frat-party din.
Of course, all of this is minor if the food is actually good. We certainly didn't find anything to rave, or praise even faintly. I had the risotto, which was a cafeteria-style rendering of the dish. The predominant flavour was "too salty." Besides cheese and lots of salt, there was no real discernible seasoning, nuanced, layered or otherwise. My wife had linguini al mare - and the title was obviously taken too literally. It was swimming in a seafood "broth" best characterized, once again, as salty. I couldn't really taste anything else in the dish to even conjure a guess as to where the chef was going form. While I'm a big fan of "letting the ingredients speak," in this dish they just kind of whisper, or gurgle.
We began our meal with unremarkable starters. A Tuscan bean soup - which, again, mostly just tasted like salt with a definite grocery-store deli vibe. My wife had a watery Caesar salad which, for the first time in our experience, had no garlic in it.
Between us we ate less than half the food. Surprisingly, maybe because they were busy, or perhaps because they're self-satisfied/arrogant, nobody asked, at any point, if we were enjoying our meal. Of course, I don't really think they cared, the service was brusque, cold and indifferent. Maybe we're too Canadian we expect nice.
In hindsight, I guess every city has those bland, over-priced, old school grad-dinner-and-anniversary Italian joints that people's grandparents really seem to love. This place definitely falls under this category.
restaurant_user_4_review:
IL Bistro is a slightly hidden, tucked away "underground" restaurant. It's super easy to miss because it's sandwiched in between the Gum Wall and a graffiti/"art" plastered wall, both of which are so easy to divert your attention to. Even though it's in the heart of all the tourist traps, it feels like a mostly-locals hangout. In fact, we wouldn't have even found this place if not for a local - and we walked right past it the day before and had no idea we passed by it.
The ambiance here is super romantic - everything is dark and candlelit making it a great date night spot! It was pretty packed but they were able to seat us "in the bar area" (not actually at the bar, but a tinier table right by the bar) right away on a Saturday around 8 pm.
We just came for drinks and snacks since we ate earlier. Their drinks + cocktails list was pages and pages but luckily our server was super helpful in choosing drinks to our liking based on our alcohol preferences. Service was great - our server had a great vibe, checked up on us just the right amount, and did her best to personalize everything we ordered so it was just the way we liked it!
We had their Antipasto Misto (selection of salami, imported cheese, marinated vegetables) - aka a meat & cheese plate. On its own it's $16, but we substituted for burrata and added bread so I'm not sure what the total came out to.
It was a really good variety, with about 3-4 cured meats and a bunch of pickled veggies like cauliflower, carrots, olives, cucumbers, bell peppers. I just wish there was more cheese than just the burrata.
Overall IL Bistro was a super cool find and a great way to feel transported elsewhere - sitting here, you totally forget you're in Downtown Seattle!
restaurant_user_5_review:
Top 5 happy hours spots in Seattle if you ask me! Their happy menu has great variety and portions. Some of personal favorites are....
-rigatoni
-caeser salad
-pizza
-bruschetta
-mac n cheese
A pike place hidden gem. And their beverages always hit the mark! Love the ambiance and music as well(:
restaurant_user_6_review:
This is one of my favorite restaurants, the food is amazing, and the waiters/waitresses are absolutely amazing. They are always on top of the menu and what tiny details there are to the food that are helpful when making the decision.
The bar is also amazing and so far the wine and cocktail selection has been delicious!
The atmosphere is also romantic and always puts me in a great mood.
Definitely recommend this place if you are on the fence about going here!
restaurant_user_7_review:
I've been coming here for years! I don't know A single tender, waitress/ waiter, greeter that works in this fine establishment!
Yet everytime I come in for the late night menu I can't help but feel like the staff already knows what I'm there for. To reserved to ask names, at the same time I feel like I already know them. And they already know me! I take comfort In seeing the same faces that have been there for a length time. ( staff ) and I've yet to be dissatisfied with the service provided.
I can say without a doubt this is one of my top five in Seattle from the gut of the market. From Seattle over all! If you are a tourist, do not rob yourself of good meal and strong drink at a more than fare price.
If this could only be the standard......
Thank you Il bistro, stay classy.
restaurant_user_8_review: I was roaming around Pike Place to get me some food before going to my work event. So I saw this cute little Italian place that looked so good, and they mentioned they have a special for smoked salmon. So I said I'll order it, but wow, just wow. I had never in my life tasted something as horrible as that. I will never eat here again in my life. I gave some to my coworker cause he loves smoked salmon and he's not picky at all, and even he thought it was horrible. On top of that the dish cost over 40 bucks. I would never recommend this dish to anyone.
restaurant_user_9_review: This restaurant is a great setting for intimate dinners. The inside is dimly lit with tablecloths covered seatings and wood accents. I recommend trying the calamari (great vibrant flavors, not the fried type), the rigatoni bolognese (hearty, savory, rich flavors), and the cioppino (filled with fresh seafood and fresh tastes). I've dined here several times, the food and service quality both have been very consistent.
restaurant_user_10_review: Hubby bought a romantic package for my birthday dinner. The table was decorated with flowers when we arrived which brought a smile on my face. We ordered bruschetta crostini for appetizer and two vegetarian pastas for entrees . Food was average, service and ambience outstanding.
restaurant_user_11_review:
It ain't what it used to be!
While service and ambiance at il bistro are always wonderful, the food has gone dramatically downhill in the last year or so. On our most recent visit, the pizza came out cold, the pasta was undercooked and the Caesar salad tasted oddly like pickles. Very strange. The visit prior featured burnt pizza and unsalted prawns... it's a smorgasbord of culinary disasters.
Despite that we will probably be back because they're open late, staff is helpful, the bartenders are friendly and the prices are low. If the food was consistent it would be a more regular spot... fingers crossed it picks back up. We will keep the faith until then!
restaurant_user_12_review: The flight from Louisiana was miserable, with crying babies and turbulence, and we walked and walked to and from the light rail, dragging our three suitcases behind. I was hungry and tired. We walked in to this restaurant out of a cold winter rain with low spirits. We were welcomed heartily by the bartender. Our server Sofia was knowledgeable and fun and explained the history of the amaro. The drinks warmed me up, and the small plates on the happy hour menu were satisfying. An unexpected, cozy welcome to Seattle.
restaurant_user_13_review:
I spent a ridiculous amount of time online reading reviews of restaurants in the city to go to for our anniversary, and nothing was jumping out at me. Cookie cutter everything. I wasn't seeing anything truly special and about threw in the towel and chose one of the usual suspects. Then, I found something about IL Bistro. The name wasn't familiar, so I looked into it a bit more. Little did I know that this was the place I'd walked past for years and years, always curious about the tucked away spot below the market entering post alley. Immediately upon seeing the photos alone, I felt butterflies in my stomach....this was most definitely the place. I booked a reservation immediately. The evening of our dinner, we took a nice stroll through the then closed and quiet Pike Place Market and he was sooo curious about where I had chosen because I kept it a secret. lol We began walking down into post alley and made the first left into this beautiful hideaway. We were immediately greeted by two very polite and funny gentlemen and lead to our table. I'd arranged for their romance package, so as we got closer he was surprised with rose petals and champagne waiting for us. Our server was amazing! Great conversation and not at all intrusive. Literally any question we had about an item on the menu, whether it be food or wine, she was able to answer in great detail. I ordered the Linguini di Mar√© (linguini with mussels, clams, calamari, white prawns, market fish, in a white wine herb broth), and it was wonderful. Every flavor stood out, none competing with the other. The broth was very light and the entire dish perfectly balanced. He ordered the Agnello al Forno (roasted lamb sirloin, rosemary polenta, ratatouille vegetables, caselvetrano olives) and devoured every last bite....before making his way to my dish. lolol
The mood in the restaurant is very intimate and cozy. There are candles everywhere creating the perfect romantic evening out with your partner, date night-anniversary-or just because.
Thank you again, IL Bistro crew! We had the perfect evening and cannot wait to return.
restaurant_user_14_review: Cute little place right in the heart of Seattle. I went here with the singer of Korpiklaani and a fellow fan. We ended up sharing a pizza and beers together. The pizza ended up being on the house because there was a bit of delay but we barely noticed because we were deep in conversation. Pretty crowded place for a Tuesday night but I can definitely see why. Good quality food and drinks and I would definitely return sometime in the future.
restaurant_user_15_review:
I love this restaurant!
I'll Bistro is a wonderful Italian restaurant with an intimate homey atmosphere and great food.
I've been here several times and have never had a bad experience. It's right by Pike Place so I thought the prices would be high, but was surprised by the very reasonable prices (mid to low $20s for entrees, high teens for pasta dishes).
restaurant_user_16_review: Always friendly fabulous service and overall lovely experience when eating here. Food is spot on, especially the special entrees. Will continue to enjoy this as one of our neighborhood favorites.
restaurant_user_17_review: We went there last night for a company dinner. The food and atmosphere was amazing, and the service was great. Highly recommend this place
restaurant_user_18_review: The food is solid but the cocktails are world class. IL Bistro is in my Top 5 places in Seattle to go for a drink and grab a bite to eat. I just tell the bartender what I typically like and ask to have something created. Last night I said Mezcal, citrus forward and not too sweet. The result is seen in the photo. It was fabulous. The Late Night Food Menu make this place a great pick after a concert. The bar is open until 2 but I think food is only available until midnight. Happy Hour specials are also great. Folks in the service industry come here after work and I love that about the place. Nothing against tourists (I mean this sincerely) but it's nice to have places that cater more to locals.
restaurant_user_19_review:
This place is the most underrated bar in the area. Cursed as an industry bar because of its dark and hidden location Il Bistro is filled with a lineup of the best bartenders I know in Seattle. This is my favorite stop for a prefunk, dinner, happy hour, etc.
The Venue is dark and equipped for live music. Beautiful red roses salute the bar as beautiful orange lanterns illuminate the detail in the bartenders craft. Dan the man is my favorite. Bar manager, relatable genius, daring mixologist, and a class act. I come with a different request every day and his drinks not only satisfy but inspire.
The happy hour pizza is great, pastas are delish, but honestly I only come for drinks and ill make a trip just to see Dan. If you're trying to meet people in Seattle and have an intimate adventure with a bartender, this is my recommendation.
restaurant_user_20_review: Best flourless chocolate torte I have ever had! Just the right balance of sweet and chocolate with mascarpone dollop and toasted hazelnuts in the drizzle! Service was more than excellent.

restaurant_user_1_review:
Hail to the chef. Why are these restaurants only in Seattle?
It's as if all these great chefs slaved away in the industry for years, and one day woke up and said, you know what? I'm going to buy a small place, house, bottom floor of a building with three chiropractic offices, and just run my own small kitchen where I can float casually between the pan my guests tables, regaling them with stories of my cooking career and adventures, all the while wowing them with absolutely incredible dishes.
honestly, just order whatever you want. some of the best gnocchi with lamb we can remember, but the osso buco. This was the best I have had since Francesco's off Hegenberger in Oakland that closed in 2016 after 47 years.
restaurant_user_2_review:
I would give them 3 1/2 stars if I could but they were A-OK!
We came here one night and were seated on the back patio right away.
The service was super friendly. A couple people touched our table throughout the night to make sure all was well. That is always appreciated.
The food was OK. We got a lamb rack with gnocchi and salmon pasta. The gnocchi was really chewy and just inedible but the lamb was very tasty! The salmon pasta really wasn't anything to rave about. Nothing stuck out about it, pretty basic.
Overall, the outside seating was nice, the service was friendly and the food was ok! Nothing to complain about it and it was a nice experience.
They did give complimentary tiramisu at the end and that was nice.
restaurant_user_3_review: I just wanted to update in case the restaurant owners look at this - - I really like this restaurant, but I have to agree with some others that the ambience could be a nicer... Maybe less harsh lighting, candles? I can't recall if there was music. I mention this because I was thinking of this place for Valentine's day dinner, but I decided against it only because of the not-very-romantic ambience. If that's not what you need with dinner, though, then I recommend this restaurant!
restaurant_user_4_review: Had a date night and was craving Italian. The decor was bland, but was hoping the food would make up for it. Ordered the chicken marsala and ravioli. The chicken was not fresh, was bland, and had the consistency of rubber. The ravioli was okay, but lacked any flavor. Overall disappointed.
restaurant_user_5_review:
We had a great time at Zouave's restaurant a couple weeks ago. The food was DELICIOUS and plentiful. We had a great conversation with the chef, and the server was also great. They seemed very knowledgable about the dishes and the wines of Italy as well as cuisine from other parts of the Mediterranean.
I highly recommend this intimate little restaurant if your looking for a special experience!
restaurant_user_6_review:
We came in wanting to like this place and left feeling just... sad.
The food is awful. Like reheated chain restaurant quality. Your wine choices are clearly so bad they won't provide the brand label on the menu. The decor I would describe as Italian themed man-cave.
I'm writing this review to maybe help correct, as other reviews have noted, what seems like a high level of fake positive reviews for this restaurant.
I hope the owner can improve this place, maybe limiting the menu options would help.
restaurant_user_7_review:
I walked in to the cute restaurant and went for a sweet spot in the back porch on a warm day. My husband and I were excited by this charming little spot. Cute, cozy with a great neighborhood feel. We ordered wine, both of us thought was Meh... Their house was not our taste (me White, He red)
Then the food came. We got the antipasto plate that was lacking variety. Then I had Gnocci and he had the Chicken Marsala. Both were bland, the chicken was not moist and kind of rubbery. The Gnocci was chewy too. The service was slow.
Sad to say, I wanted to like this cute little spot but we won't be back.
restaurant_user_8_review: Hidden Italian gourmet! Nice patio and great food. Met the chef and he was very friendly with suggestions on the food. The mushroom soup was really good! My dish the chicken prosciutto was a bit saltier than I like, but was still delicious!
restaurant_user_9_review:
We decided to come here because of the reviews on Yelp. It was a bit empty when we walked in so we decided to sit out in the patio. We stared at the menu for quite some time as we didn't know what any of the dishes looked like (I'm a visual-kind-of-person). After Googling some dishes and speaking with our server, she suggested the Lamb Ragout Penne Pasta (minus the lamb ragout-vegetarian option) and the Gnocchi. We waited almost an hour for our food, which we weren't too upset about because the chef's wife mentioned that the bread and pasta sauces are all made from scratch. Let me just tell you, THE WAIT WAS WORTH IT. The food came out really hot, but it was delicious! I don't typically like gnocchi, but this gnocchi had a perfect potato ratio. And the penne pasta I had was surprisingly very good. At the end of our meal we were offered a slice of tiramisu, on the house (the chef also made from scratch) for having to wait so long. Tiramisu isn't my first choice when it comes to Italian desserts, but the texture was soft and sweet enough.
Overall, I definitely recommend it! The people were super friendly and the food is delicious.
restaurant_user_10_review:
This is such a hidden gem. It's little house-looking restaurant on 65th. My babe friend and I have been here a few times and whenever we're feeling fancy, we go here. We LOVE the lamb shank with the gnocchi. Always a yes when we come and thankfully it's a special every time we're there. Tonight we also had the ribeye special (11-12oz!!!!!!) with ravioli, which was cooked amazingly and was chewy and tender!!! The food portions made us so sleepy because it was just so much food :-)
I love the service as well. Typically there's a server and a waitress but it was just the chef when we were there tonight, and he is always so kind! Amazing chef and owner 100%. We were also given free dessert. Ahh, please support!! It's totally worth the money.
restaurant_user_11_review: This place was incredible. It is our second time going there. The chef is not only talented but so delightful to talk with. The menu is a reflection of his talents. The food was so tastefully prepared and had a distinctly delightful depth of flavor. The four of each ordered something different and each dish was so good. We ordered cannoli's and they were as good as any of us East Coaster's have ever had. He gave us a sample of his Tiramisu and it was wonderful. Will definitely go back time and again.
restaurant_user_12_review: Our large party was treated so well here. The chef/owner kept checking in to make sure everything was to our liking. He need not have worried, because we had a great time here. Their large outdoor seating area (with plenty of shade) was perfect, as was their menu and its execution. I had a yummy smoked salmon with penne pasta. Everyone else loved their choices as well. The owner even included a couple of plates of tiramisu on the house for us to share. So nice of him. I'd love to come back here when in the neighborhood again.
restaurant_user_13_review:
Excellent paella and Cioppino!! Wow!!
Fresh seafood-all home made
And the chef and wait staff personable and efficient and really nice.
The Tiramisu was to die for and made by the chef owner-- come just for that and you will love it!
restaurant_user_14_review: Either the reviews here are questionable or Seattle-ites don't have a palate but this really wasn't good. Ordered the paella and seafood wasn't fresh, the dish smelled fishy before I went in for my first bite.
restaurant_user_15_review:
Ordered "Penne with vegetables and marinara."
Pasta was overcooked and soggy. The sauce as watery and insipid.
Not sure why exactly there were green onions in my dish.
Was actually really nice to dine outside 'though, and the sangria was very tasty! Too bad, the food really stunk.
restaurant_user_16_review:
Absolutely fantastic. New baby at home, birthday...no way we could go out for dinner. Zouave saved us.
Meals were fantastic. I had lamb with gnocchi. One of the best lamb meals i have had. Everyone loved their dinners. Flavors were great. Seasoning was spot on.
Cannot say enough about the staff. I think it was Jason who took my call. Order was perfect. They even threw in a bit extra. I will be going back next time i am down here visiting my daughter.
Thank you so much!
restaurant_user_17_review:
The best meal I've had in Seattle and I've done the hot spots. Not only is the food great, but the owners are a family and make you feel like you're coming to a friends house for dinner.
Can't wait to visit again
restaurant_user_18_review:
This is a little gem. Their food is full of flavours, and are very uniquely designed - definitely some authentic Italian pastas and entr√©es. I tried the lobster ravioli with shrimp. The sauce was great! One of the best I have ever tasted. However the lobster ravioli was not very fresh and as someone who is sensitive to the fresh taste of seafood I can tell that it has been keep for a while. The portion was decent, but may not be enough for big appetite. My friends ordered the lamb shank, which was well cooked, soft and soaked in flavoues. The shank has lots of meat. We also ordered their seafood fried rice, which is equally awesome. Their seafood pasta is good, though not spenlendid.
We can see their cheif cooking. It seems there is just one/two people preparing and cooking the food so it takes a while to get our food. They gave free bread as appetizers. We also ordered their tiramisu which I am not a fan of. Overall a solid restaurant.
restaurant_user_19_review:
The chef and the staff were really nice, and it's a cute place. If you want to eat a home-made meal that you could make (if you had the time, and you are not the best cook)then this is it.
If you are looking for really good eats or you are a foodie, this is not it.
So although I wanted to like this place, since it's a local restaurant with kind staff, I won't be going back.
I feel awful writing such a negative review, but I think it's deceptive for other yelp users to see 4.5. Mioposto got 4 stars when its amazing! There's something really fish going on here! I'm wondering if there are made up reviews on this!!!
restaurant_user_20_review: I absolutely love this place. Definitely come in the evening and dine outside. I brought two friends, and two of us got the ravioli and the other got the sicilian tortellini. Also, try their soup of the day if you have room. Their service was amazing, and our waiter had the most beautiful, golden voice you can imagine. I'm talking about that deep, sonorous, mellifluous TV talk show host type voice. 10/10 baby.

restaurant_user_1_review:
Super super delicious pie! Contrary to what it says to on Yelp, the inside bar is only open till 1 but the window for to-go is open till 2.
Went around 1 last night, and unfortunately it was closed inside but we were able to take a few pieces to go.
They were out of the apple crumble so I got the deserted island and it was warm and soooo delicious! The guy at the front counter was awesome and even gave us extra ice cream to make up for no apple crumble.
Super impressed and will definitely come back! My friends got the savory pies so I'm trying that next.
restaurant_user_2_review:
If you like pie & great drinks then you have died and gone to pie heaven!
First, there is a window that accessible from the street to buy from so you don't have to go inside. The bar itself is TINY and sits about 25 (and that's if you want to get cozy with the people around you).
If you are lucky enough to get a seat at the bar then you will get a chance to be in pie heaven with drinks!
Everything is good. We normally start with a savory pie, the apple crumble/pumpkin. My favorite martini is the key lime pie.
If you have a chance to visit you really should make a special stop here!
restaurant_user_3_review:
I've had the strawberry rhubarb pie and the berry pie. Both delicious. Love that they give a scoop of vanilla ice cream on the side. Drinks are pricey but look interesting. I feel bad coming here without ordering a drink but their pies are just too good. Excited to try the rest of the menu, possibly a savory pie my next visit!
Interior is similar to what you expect of a bar, dim lit and small. I personally like it a lot, but it is a bit hard to move around inside. Staff are friendly.
If you're craving pie just come here. You wont be disappointed (can also get takeout).
restaurant_user_4_review: This place is super unique and one of my favorite stops in Seattle after the dinner rush. Very simple menu of an assortment of pies and really good mixed drinks. The apple crumb pie is my favorite and it's cooked perfectly. All you need to do is walk right up to the window and shop for a good piece of pie! You'll get a nice piece of pie on a to go plate with a fork so you can continue on your journey as you indulge. you can also go inside that has a few seats if you want a nice dessert experience with a drink. We tried their chocolate martini and it was made really well. The only downside to going inside is that your potential to have another piece of pie just went up! That being said, the strawberry rhubarb pie is sooooo goooooood!
restaurant_user_5_review:
Pie bar is the dream pie shop I want to open when I'm a 65 year-old hip Grandma living in Seattle. 5-stars for the pie. Is it pricey? Yes. Is it worth it? Absolutely. Who doesn't want to have Pietinis and slices of pie?!
Strawberry rhubarb pie is the pie you were missing every summer, every dream, every day of your life. Must have. Pair it with any Pietini of your liking to complete the dream.
I've been to both the Ballard and Capital Hill locations which are very different. There is limited seating at the Capital Hill location in case you have a large party. Pie and drinks wise the locations are probably the same, but the atmosphere is much more modern and the shop is more spacious in Ballard. It honestly looks like a rustic bachelorette party inside and I love it. This is not just a place for ladies! On their website the baker says they created Pie Bar to make people happy, and they have succeeded. " An hour at Pie Bar is an hour of therapy."
restaurant_user_6_review: I've waited to come here for a few years as I only recently 1) turned 21 and 2) had the time to come out here! The pie was DELICIOUS. The service was great and it's the perfect spot for a chill evening with drinks! :)
restaurant_user_7_review:
The pie bar was ok, Pie was really good. Drinks where just ok. Not completely amazing but ok. I got an old fashion and it wasn't the best one of had. Ordered one of the Pietini drinks and it was good.
Pietini run $11 so not a cheap drink. The old fashion was also $11. So not necessarily the place to come if you think you are looking for cheap drinks. The place is small so not a whole lot of room there.
In summary I'd probably stop by for take out pie.
restaurant_user_8_review:
Went to this place on a Tuesday night and it was relatively empty, which was great! No line . The atmosphere was pretty hip and the lights were dim, which I didn't mind.
We ordered the pumpkin pie, Apple Pie Moscow mule, and the Ron burgundy. The pumpkin pie was pretty average but I wished I got the desert island or the buffalo chicken pie that the servers told us were the most popular.
The service was really good and the servers were really friendly.
Overall, I'd recommend others to try this place out.
restaurant_user_9_review: The coolest bar you'll go to in Seattle. It's tiny, so not the best for a group and also it fills up very fast - but a must see! They are serving up beer, craft cocktails and PIETINI'S. Yes you read that right and I'm here to say they are delicious. They are baking pies at the bar, right in front of you. The pie is all amazing, you can't go wrong. It's eclectic and homey inside with lights and pitchers hanging from the ceiling. There's also a window you can just stop by and grab a slice of pie to go.
restaurant_user_10_review:
We went here after a Christmas party to grab some pie and some drinks. And what an amazing concept this bar has: pies and alcohol. Brilliant!
It's located on the main street and it's fairly small but you can't miss it whatsoever because of the colorful hanging lantern lights and the window that is coming out with a display of pies behind it. We got lucky with parking and also getting a table. We looked over the menu quickly and espresso martini was what captured my attention along with the coconut cream pie and a the mud pie.
Not long after my drink was out followed by the pies. That espresso martini was probably one of the best martinis I've had in a very long time. The waitress told me that the secret was that they make the drink with cold brew. I took one bite from each pies and I was instantly in heaven. The coconut cream pie was very tasty and full of coconut flavor. It was delicious and very fresh. The mud pie was very dense and extremely delicious full of peanut butter flavor. That was also absolutely tasty!
Overall it was a fantastic experience here and I highly recommend it to anyone that is in the mood for some good drinks and/or pies.
restaurant_user_11_review:
This tiiiiny place is so packed with good stuff! It's a really fun late-night spot to satisfy those sweet cravings. We came here last night to cap off my birthday and had such a great time. I'm just sad that I live 4 hours away! Probably for the best though, cuz I'd be here far too many times per week.
The atmosphere was a micro-sized, divey, loud metal-music-playing gem, wedged into a strange triangular shaped space. I was surprised we even got a seat here, late on a Saturday night, but we filled the last 2 spots. They have sooo many pies! Savory and sweet - they all looked awesome. But we'd already eaten dinner so this trip was strictly for dessert purposes.
I got a chocolate pie-tini and my husband got a hot toddy. Oh my gosh my drink was so good. I could sip those all night. Topped these dessert cocktails off with a buttery hot slice of apple pie, and it might have been the best apple pie I've ever had. It had a perfect ratio of crust/crumble to filling, and the apples were super cooked down and soft. I may have even been able to eat the whole pie. I was sitting right by the area where they are displayed and the only thing stopping me was a thin wall of glass barrier haha.
Thanks Pie Bar for being a fun last stop on a great day! This was the perfect ending.
restaurant_user_12_review:
Oh the Pie Bar. One of my 'must-go' places on my list when I visited Seattle a couple months ago. It definitely lived up to the hype!
It's a really small place on the corner, but don't let that fool you. Their pies were amazing. I also got a chocolate cake martini and that was amazing as well.
If I'm in the Seattle area again soon, I will definitely be stopping by the Pie Bar for a late night dessert!
restaurant_user_13_review:
Absolutely love love love this place!
This is a total hole in the wall. Literally. They operate out of this tiny place where you place your order by this window. I swear everything on their menu is delicious. I absolutely love the strawberry rhubarb pie. The crust is so delicious. It tastes great warm so eat fast! but it also tastes great if you heat it up at home too. something about the topping they put on their pie is unlike anything I've ever eaten. The filling is not too sweet where it overpowers the pie and you'd get bored of it. It's so good!
This is a must try place in Seattle!
restaurant_user_14_review:
Pie Bar is such a unique restaurant that is so Seattle. As the name says, they sell pies. You can get pieces by the slice either from their outdoor side window or you can go inside for a sit down. The restaurant itself is very small. You seat yourself so when our group of three went inside, it felt like we were nudging bodies as we waddled towards the free bar seats. I would suggest if you were to come here with a group (aka bigger than a party of 2) to get the pies to go. It's not worth going through the hassle of getting seats inside.
My friend got the chocolate pie which turned out to be more of a mousse than we expected. Bf and I shared the Strawberry Rhubarb. It had a good amount of sweetness and tartness! I really enjoyed the pie. The vanilla ice cream on the side was alright. It wasn't anything special- which makes sense I mean they are called the Pie Bar.
They have a variety of pies categorized in sweet to savory. The menus is rotating with a couple of classic pies that remain on the menu from month to month but it does bring a bit of excitement to those who frequent the establishment with new treats every visit. Definitely would recommend coming here if you are in Seattle and looking for a warm dessert.
restaurant_user_15_review:
My friends and I decided to come here after a late movie premiere. We had a group of 12, and learned upon arrival that they're not the greatest for large groups. Thankfully, they do take out orders, so we were able to order our pies and hang out together on the street.
The majority of us stuck to the sweet pies, Apple Crumble, Strawberry rhubarb crumble, and deserted island. All three of the flavours were delicious and we'd definitely order them again.
When you order take out, they ask if you want it warmed, and if so, they grab the slice, put it into a cardboard box, and then microwave it before giving it to you. If you're not a fan of microwaved pie, heads up.
Things to note: Parking is street parking only. There's no garbage can out on the streets to throw your garbage out once you're done, so you'll need to ring the bell and let the staff know you'd like the box to be thrown away.
restaurant_user_16_review: It was honestly alright and pretty pricey. I asked for the most popular pie and it was the strawberry rhubarb crumble. I got it and had high expectations. However the pie was overpowered by the berries. I would have liked to taste another flavor.
restaurant_user_17_review:
The pies were delicious! I got the strawberry rhubarb and butter beer, while my fianc√© got coconut creme pie and apple pie Moscow mule. I literally inhaled my slice! If you have a sweet tooth definitely check this place out!
If you don't have a sweet tooth, it's okay they have other options. I really liked that they also offered savory pies. The spot is pretty small, so don't really recommend if you have a large group. But, don't worry they have a window you can order from and take out. They're also open until 2, so great for after a night out on cap hill.
Their cocktails hit the spot too, the apple pie Moscow mule literally tasted like apple pie. They also have a lot of different pie inspired cocktails, can't wait to try some more.
restaurant_user_18_review:
* Dessert place *
Pie bar is my all time favorite bar! I used to come here with my best friend almost every week until I gained 3 lbs. ugh!
I usually get apple pie moonshine mule and a deserted island pie. It has all types of berries in it. The crust is so good and smell so buttery. I like their pie because they have the right amount of sweetness.
I would recommend to go to the one in Ballard if you have a big group because it's bigger and easier to find a spot.
Food: 10/10
Service: 10/10
Environment: 10/10 (the one in cap hill is super crowded and the place is so small and cute, highly recommend to order take out)
restaurant_user_19_review:
If you don't mind waiting outside for a long time and shelling out more money than you expect, come to Pie Bar for some damn good pie. Came here on a rainy night and had to wait forever at the to-go window just to get a slice of the Desserted Island and some ice cream. The reason why it took so long was because there was only one person handling the orders and food prep, and he was taking his sweeeet time like there wasn't a long line of people waiting in the rain.
The mix of various berries and apple in the pie was nice, but the best part of the pie was the crumble. I wish I could have just the crumble because it was really that good. Too bad that I ended up paying ~$10 for pie with ice cream but did not receive that much pie or ice cream. Also I'm not sure how fresh their pies actually are since I saw slices being microwaved and then served...
restaurant_user_20_review: Very cute dessert+drink place in capital hill. The apple crumble pie was so good and apple pie mule went well with the pie. I would definitely recommend this place!

restaurant_user_1_review: Had a wonderful experience here celebrating my kiddos 11th birthday party. Staffs were awesome. Food was delicious. Kids got to enjoy the lights off and glow-bowling experience. We even got glow stick necklaces.
restaurant_user_2_review:
They got me with the budget cuts...
Grabbed a pizza while we had the kids out bowling.
The menu says "Wall To Wall Pepperoni - for $21.65."
The menu statement and the bowling alley must have a very different understanding on what "Wall To Wall Pepperoni" actually is.
Now, I'm posting the photo's and you tell me....
Am I missing something right here?
Like half of the pepperoni??..
If the kids hadn't killed half the pizza I would of sent it back.
I did mention it when I went back up for another beer and the girl said that was a normal pizza.
At least take the Wall To Wall Pepperoni part off the menu, or put the rest of the Pepperoni on there....
restaurant_user_3_review:
Good bowling alley.
3 stars for customer service from the manager. She was in between bites and shoving food down her throat in between helping me at the front desk and licking her fingers between bites.
I have to say their pancakes are delicious LOL but eat lunch on yo break!
restaurant_user_4_review:
Narrows Bowling
Fun, Fun, Fun... 3 times n I'll walk u thru wat I mean..
But, I gotta warn u that the commercial I'm about 2 tell u is pretty rough.. walking in2 the entrance n in2 the hallway.. the restrooms looked old w/ no mirrors n missing door handles, pretty run down so far.. but place was full of life w/ happy kids n family bowling..
Fun #1 or 1st fun: bowling.. u can change different themes on the layout of the screen scoreboard
Fun #2: u have a big ol' arcade area where u can win tickets.. games such as racing, basketball, shooting
Fun #3: the lounge looks well dated/aged but the bartender brings it 2 life w/ her personality n the basic Maker's Mark w/ ginger ale taste right
Final thought, let's bring in Jerry Springer: I think if I stick around long enough @ this place, I may find Earl Anthony artifacts
It's my 400th review; shout out 2 all of u Yriends out there!
restaurant_user_5_review: This place sucks! Save your money and go somewhere else. We payed for 2 hrs and weren't even able to finish the first game and when we went to the front desk to inquire about the time issue we were told that the lanes had gotten reserved by another party and that he couldn't do anything about it with a shitty attitude and that we had to move. Terrible customer service!
restaurant_user_6_review:
Well, I've almost been here before, and decided to go today with my son. We got two pairs of shoes and 3 games of bowling, for 52$. Definitely more than most places.
There was one kid working the counter, which was being overwhelmed, when another worker came up eating some food, asking him when he's being relieved (while I was being served) like I wasn't even there. She walked away disinterested.
We went to bowl and the attendant only put one person in the computer, then there was the kid bowling ramp in the lane, which I moved, and then I had to ask him to lower the gutter rails that were up. It took us about 5 minutes until we were ready to actually bowl.
After bowling I gave my son some tokens and went to order food, chicken fingers and fries and fish and fries. We got a buzzer while we played.
They do have a big selection of games, all take tokens, which one of the change machines wasn't working.
It must have seriously been 50 minutes to 1 hour for our food to make it out.
The whole time we were in the arcade, which with it's good variety, was also a bit overpriced, two games I played didn't work, the skeeball and one of the football ones. My buzzer didn't even go off, for the food.
I just had to go up about 6 times and politely stand there every 10 minutes of so hoping they'd get the hint that it's been FOREVER. There we're 3 workers back there, but it just looked really disorganized and frantic. Instead of dropping the fries and chicken at the same time, they were all done separately. I watched 4 different people come up and get food that ordered after me.
The food was really salty and overcooked, yeah we got battered fish and chicken tenders but they were both really overdone, while the fries were underdone and way over salted.
All said and done, I probably wouldn't go back. Just seemed overpriced and customer service was definitely lacking.
52$ for bowling (poor service)
20$ for fish and chicken tenders (overcooked)
15$ in tokens
Not worth it in my opinion. There are better places
restaurant_user_7_review:
But why tho? Is my whole thought process here.
Look I get it. Bowling alleys are dying out, like arcades, and mom and pop shops.
Pacific Lanes is getting the axe, and in a few years who knows what will become of this place.
But it's still no excuse to get caught slacking on your pimpin..
Look here's the sitch, I rolled through, on a sunday, lunch time, had a work thing. Y'all would think it's quiet and slow, maybe some short and quick service get some vittles and put some balls in holes...
So I come in try to pay for bowling... Two games easy right? Bippity boppity back the fuck up because it took this lady 17 minutes to figure out how much to charge us and whether or not we are charged for shoe rental. Sorry but my back hurt from doing her job for her. She didn't know her anus from elbow, and kept looking at the screen like someone switched the language setting to Mandarin.
Fast forward I decide to order food, all I wanted was some "Super Nachos". There were like 10-15 people in the entire places and only 6 or 7 of them actually order food.
1. The lady taking orders an older lady, very sweet and treated me very kindly.
2. You're given a pager to send you into a false sense of security that you might actually get to eat today.
3. Literally everyone who ordered food, had to wait between 45-75 minutes for food. (so glad I didn't come hungry, by the time I ate I was chewing at my wrists. Honestly I can't remember if it was to have sustanence or to kill myself to stop hunger pains.)
4. Can we talk about how Not super these fucking nachos were? Like they looked okay at first. Like how cab something be salty and flavorless? Also the chips were stale a f, and felt like someone cut out cardboard pictures of chips and covered it with cheese. Also the cheese sauce......was it cheese? I feel like it was some large animals sperm in large quantities.... I feel pregnant... Anyway it wasn't good..
5. WHY HOT JIZZ CHEESE BUT COLD ASS TACO MEAT?! (WHY!?)
Any way im not totally gonna trash this place, but there's no excuse for sub par service on a slow day... Apparently this is a routine for them on days when certain staff aren't here.. 3 stars is the best I can do. You're better than this narrows... If this wasn't 1 of 3 bowling alleys left in town. I'd skip this place entirely.
Make you're own judgement tho..
restaurant_user_8_review: I'm not a huge fan of their food, but I love the place. If you know me, I'm a pretty avid bowler, so finding an alley around my residence is important. I don't hate some of the others nearby, but if I get to choose I pick Narrows. Usually mid day is totally chill - league is happening but they still have some lanes available for old timers such as myself. Go Narrows!
restaurant_user_9_review:
I currently live near Austin, TX but have been back in WA caring for an ill family member for the past two months.
I brought my bowling gear with me because I wanted to stay in shape for my 2 leagues back home. Narrows was the closest bowling alley to where my sister lives, and I used to bowl there many years ago, so that's where I practiced 2-3 times a week.
I have to say the crew there has been amazing as my "home away from home" the past two months. Special shout outs to BRENDA and CLAYTON who have been just great. Also to the manager, CHRIS, who was answering questions for me via email before I even arrived.
Machines appear to be well maintained and I hardly had any issues. Never even had to call for a ball return.
Thanks guys for taking care of me. I had a great experience there....even if my score didn't always reflect it lol
restaurant_user_10_review:
We pretty much go here for the decent prices and location.
Downside:
Rental shoes: last time they were in bad shape they handed them to me with something spilled on them from last renter..
Glow bowl: should be called disco bowl. A kid in our large group had to stop because they got so dizzy.
Skip anything that should be a hot snack: We warn people that bowl with us but when they're hungry and get something anyways -they always end up throwing it out. Lol
The bar: Ordered beer for our group, paid leaving a large tip & went back to bowling. Beer never showed up so I went back in the bar to see what was going on. The bartender said they don't bring it out & I had to show them receipt since guy that took order left- took a while for them to get a picture of beer..
restaurant_user_11_review: Had super fun only problem was no red bull joined the restaurant bowling league had a blast great time cant wait too bring kids too bowl
restaurant_user_12_review: Very clean place! Little on the expensive side compared to the other bowling alleys in the area. We had fun!
restaurant_user_13_review: A good local bowling alley. Great food and deals and the arcade is decent. Way across the parking lot there is a play area/arcade/food place called Odyssey 1 and it is GREAT and SO FUN for kids. I know I had such a blast there when I was little. What I loved to do when I was little was go bowling here, then just drive up across the parking lots to Odyssey 1. You will really get exhausted but VERY worth the fun. Also, right across from this building is an old theatre named Galaxy Narrows 8 Theatre. I wish it was still open although it was very old but it was a really great theatre. What was really good about these places around was that you could go bowling and then watch a movie at Galaxy. It closed in 2013. They should really renovate or demolish that theatre and open up a brand new one... All the way in Tukwila (around Seattle) there is a fun little place called ACME Bowl and they have a GIANT claw machine. My family and I would always win big prizes and my siblings and I just wished there was one close by because that game is fun for all ages lol... Then later that August of 2015, my family and I drove past this bowling alley and realized that we haven't been here in YEARS. We went there and there it was! THE BIG CLAW! We were so excited and happy. We've been winning big prizes since and now our basement is packed with them... Anyways been going here since I was little but they should really renovate their bathrooms and their chairs near the lanes but this is a great bowling alley.
restaurant_user_14_review: Clean, especially the shoes which I appreciate. Customer service was great too. Our family bowled for one hour 25 dollars shoes included as well as 3 free sodas and a bag of coins for the arcade came with this price. Definitely a place I would return to for a family outing. I loved the vintage skeeball machine in the arcade as well
restaurant_user_15_review: This review is of the High End Cafe inside the bowling alley. The staff is so awesome and helpful, but the food is pretty disappointing. The cheese fries have a really chemically flavour and I am pretty sure my coconut shrimp wasn't cooked through. Everyone was very lovely though so that makes up for it and adds a star.
restaurant_user_16_review:
I can't even sing their praises enough.
Narrows Plaza Bowl, Chris Goddard your team was fantastic from the moment we arrived!! Front desk staff; consistently sweet, helpful, & professional! The food was great! My family enjoyed patty melts, mushroom burgers, & pizza; fresh, not greasy, you could taste everything on the burgers, & again the staff was polite & moved quickly. The staff moving around cleaning up were very efficient, super helpful, and again polite!! We really appreciated the help and support get ready and then setup on the day for our Relay for Life fundraiser. You have an OUTSTANDING team!
And thank YOU for honoring our cancer Survivors the way you did! APPRECIATED!
Fantastic place to Bowl & eat (my husband reports good things about the bar as well) AND a fun and profitable place for a fundraiser! RFL got a good amount of our ticket sales (we paid around $32 per lane for 2-hours, drinks and fancy shoes included) AND we get a percentage of the food our guests ate (and we ATE!)
Chris, THANKS TO YOU AND YOUR TEAM!!
restaurant_user_17_review: Inexpensive fun for sure! They have a small arcade that the kids had fun collecting tickets from. They exchanged the tickets for a few candy prizes, lol. The bowling alley is full most of the time during the weekend. It's better to go early as well. They have a very good house made ginger beer (alcohol free) that is so yummy!!! Low key spot...
restaurant_user_18_review:
Pretty much your average Bowling Alley with all the basic needs.
Been here a couple times expecting to be the cliche bowling alley, and I was correct. The great thing is the prices around the early noon time to where it's only $6 for a couple hours.
The service was super slow when I needed a Ramp for my 2 year old.
I had to remind them 4 times and I had to pay extra for it.
Who does that?
restaurant_user_19_review:
Narrows Plaza Bowl is an amazing establishment, where I always have an amazing experience! Jill, Payge and their newest employee Daenette are amazing (we have been here now more than 6-7 time). For food, drinks, fun arcade games and bowling, the fun never stops! I am always able to request music during Glow Bowl and Jill always make sure we are taken care of.
The Good Time's Lounge is where our favorite bar hands are, Tyler and Carmella; always in a good mood, both serve us the best drinks and the best times! I love going in for karaoke on Saturdays and we always bowl on Fridays (always starting in the lounge).
All in all Narrows Plaza Bowl is a great establishment for good honest fun. It is family friendly, but for adults is even better. I love how I am always taken care of, and there is always room for me and my crew. Will be back again tonight--I literally come here every weekend.
Love you guys at NPB!
-Christopher & Family
restaurant_user_20_review:
I like coming to this place a lot. I'm usually here on Fridays in the arcade where me and some friends own a machine. The staff that works here gives it their all, and I really appreciate that.
There is ample parking for even the busiest of nights. And there is a large amount of lanes available for those who are actually here to bowl.
The only reason this isn't a 5 star review is the food. Granted some of it is good, I'm not a huge fan of most of it. But hey, what can you really expect of a bowling alley.
Prices are reasonable and there is always the arcade if you want to just do that!
Come check my friends and I out on Friday nights in the arcade on the "in the groove" machine!

restaurant_user_1_review:
One of my all-time favorite places in Seattle! The interior is charming and perfect for anything from date night to celebratory dinner. It is a bit small, so I wouldn't bring larger parties here.
The food is incredible! It's authentic and well worth the price. I always get the burrata and fried artichokes to start and finish with the pappardelle alla bolognese. Delicious!
restaurant_user_2_review:
hmm, this is the baby to the others and its a cute little place. it's tiny and I admit it felt a little claustrophobic inside, but it had some shoosh to it. it is def cozy and dark inside. it was quite picturesque, people watching on cold evening in the city.
even though we were packed in, I could hear my friend from across the table and we could have a conversation. because it was late, we fired out our orders quickly.
I had spaghetti with guanciale, which I was looking forward to. it had a little bit of heat to it and maybe it was a bit overdone, but it was a solid dish. the menu is a bit small, but I will need to come back.
restaurant_user_3_review:
Nice date night spot. Cozy dark, neighborhoody. We were seated at the bar which is a bit tight but got to watch small kitchen action. Burata was OK nothing to write home about but nice presentation. I had pasta bolognese which is a simple dish and was similarly nicely presented. Friend had gnoochi which was presented in a schooner bowl and seemed quite heavy (he thought it was only ok). Service was friendly. Menu is small which I like.
I'm giving this 3 star not because it was bad, its was as the guide says, OK (virtually everything on yelp is 4 stars given by people who can't boil water). Would I eat here again? Sure. Would I travel across town to eat here? Probably not.
restaurant_user_4_review:
Wow. I'm so disappointed to lower my rating from 5 stars to 2. I had a pretty terrible experience here my second time. I was so excited to come back here for the second time but left feeling disappointed.
When I sat down at our table, the glass on the table had lipstick on it. I asked for a new glass and got one quickly. It didn't bother me at the time. Mistakes happen.
What was most upsetting is that we never had a server. There was a server helping almost all the other tables, but the bartender took our order and dropped off our food. We never were checked up on or talked too. We even had a reservation so I don't know why we were treated like this. It was really sad because the food is delicious but since we seemed to be the only ones treated like this, it was upsetting. Maybe it was because we were younger than most of the other guests?
Overall the food is delicious, but we left feeling sad and disappointed.
restaurant_user_5_review: Brought a date here, and the atmosphere is perfect for that. It is a cozy, small, intimate restaurant, so I recommend you make reservations because there aren't many tables. From the reviews, I was expecting the food to be phenomenal, but it came up a little short. Ordered the fonduta cheese, gnocchi, and fig/prosciutto pizza. Everything was fine, but nothing stood out. To be honest, I've had better pizza at MOD pizza for less than half the price, but I guess you pay for the atmosphere of dining at a cute neighborhood restaurant. The drinks were fine and the service was satisfactory. I parked on the street a block away, at least parking was more plentiful than if the restaurant was located downtown. Overall, I wasn't blown away by anything, I would give this place a 3.5, but rounded up to a 4 to be nice.
restaurant_user_6_review:
Came here on a Saturday afternoon for early dinner before an early hike the next day. Was not expecting happy hour on a weekend but there was a full happy hour menu. I loved the truffle butter baguette (only $4 on happy hour). The butter was so creamy I ended up putting it on everything (caesar, clams, clam bread etc). We split the spaghetti which was extremely doughy and fresh. Nor a large portion but perfect for us since we had already snacked on apps and wanted to just try a pasta.
We'll be back for sure for the happy hour again and interested in trying the rotating seafood/meat main courses! Good value!
restaurant_user_7_review: I have to give 5 stars because this place is just such a little gem!! I fell in love with the ambiance - small intimate and cozy. Our waitress was so friendly and great. And the food was superb. I can't stop thinking about that amazing tiramisu! Only thing to note: it's small so great place for date night or small dinner crew not a large party.
restaurant_user_8_review: I loved everything about this place. The space was intimate with charming decor. Our server, Jeanine, was extremely kind and helpful throughout the evening. The food was wonderful. To start we got some slightly charred bread with a delicious white truffle butter that we consumed in its entirety. Then came the clams and gnocchi and those were probably my two favorite dishes of the evening. Then the pizza and risotto followed and at this point we were already starting to get full so we took half of each home to make a small amount of room for dessert. It was nice to see sizable and shareable portions. Because we were so full we shared these little nutella stuffed doughnuts with mascarpone and it was a wonderful finishing touch. Next time my family is in town this is a spot I plan on taking them to because of the quality and quantity.
restaurant_user_9_review:
This has become our favorite special occasion spot in Seattle. The cozy candlelit feeling and warmth from the moment you walk in is so inviting. One experience that has been very representative of the service we've received here; we had a reservation for our anniversary and they were slightly late to seat us, not a big deal or long wait at all - however they went out of their way to apologize and served us complimentary prosecco until our table was ready. Even the wait was fun with how kind they were!
Beyond the service, the food is incredible every. single. time. The rosemary pasta that the bolognese comes with is memorable and a favorite. Their pizzas are also always incredible, the nduja sausage is unique and our favorite for the depth of flavor in the sausage and the crust.
One of the best experiences and meals we've had in Seattle!
restaurant_user_10_review:
Dear Cantinetta,
Even when my boyfriend doesn't know how to play with blocks and dumps his pizza all over himself, you save the day and serve up another delicious, homemade gem in its place. I love sitting at the bar by the kitchen chatting about the meal prep, although I wish if you ordered too much baguette from the local boulangerie, you would donate it instead of tossing in the trash. Your cocktails are bomb, service stellar and pizzas amazeballs. Good thing we live closeby otherwise we'd have a huge carbon footprint getting over here.
xxo,
Liana
restaurant_user_11_review:
Went here for date night and was very impressed. We got seated in the back of the restaurant in a bar style section overlooking the chefs... and let me just say, I think this was the most coveted seat in the place. During the time we were there we heard multiple come in asking for the seats. As fun as it was to was watch the food being made, we couldn't help feeling awkward!!! What is the protocol here?!?! Are you supposed to talk to the chefs??? They're basically sitting at your table with you.. what do you do?!???
Despite feeling like newbs and not knowing the 'right' way to handle our sitting situation. Everything was perfect. Atmosphere was warm, cozy, and romantic!pizza and pasta were delish. Yummy cocktails. Highly recommend! Just be sure to make reservations- it's a tiny place!
restaurant_user_12_review: Grabbed dinner here for the second time. Such a great spot! The first time we went we sat at the bar and got to watch all the food being made. It was awesome. This time we sat at a corner table and it was great too we got the fried artichokes. So good! For dinner I got the crab risotto and my partner got the nduja sausage pizza. Both were fantastic. I think the risotto was a little salty. I think the kitchen was a little heavy handed on salt (even the artichokes were a little salty). The first time we came here that wasn't the case everything was seasoned perfectly. For dessert we got the zeppole. Such a great restaurant and becoming a favorite of ours!
restaurant_user_13_review: Would have been four stars but at the end of our happy hour seated at the bar a cockroach crawled right over the bar top and under the silverware tray... Nice cocktail but wouldn't eat there again for cleanliness reasons.
restaurant_user_14_review: Love this little place! Small seasonal menu, Food is always good, the staff is so nice and it's just a cute space with indoor and outdoor seating! I prefer the space during the summer where you can sit outside and they have all the doors open because it can get a little hot inside since the kitchen is right there at the bar and it's such a small space so I usually don't like to sit at the bar.
restaurant_user_15_review: I had the crab risotto and a peroni. I must say it was simply AMAZING! So much flavor and nice big chunks of crab.
restaurant_user_16_review: Great food and even better drinks! Such a great place for a date or special night out.
restaurant_user_17_review:
Delicious!
-Truffle cheese. It was just ok.
-Cesear salad- delicious and fresh with mixed greens rather than the regular boring lettuce.
-Clam- delicious and savory. Not rubbery. I wish there was more bread to dip in the delicious broth
-Bolognase is amazing! Love the pile of fresh grated Parmesan, noodles are perfectly cooked.
Cocktails are great. Service is very nice. Chef is also so nice to chat with a bit!
restaurant_user_18_review:
Now, this place can get loud as mud, which for someone that has hearing issues, is a freaking dining nightmare BUT see how I still gave them 5 stars? ( owner, if you're listening, putting in some ceiling noise dampeners would be sooo appreciated )
I've walked by and stared into the windows here many a times wishing to check it out. I had high expectations based solely on the cuteness factor. Finally got a chance to go and expectations were met and then some. We shared two starters, a serving of bread and one main entree. Not to mention a fancy ass bottle of Delille D2 DELICIOUS wine.
We had the cauliflower and the beef carpaccio starters. The beef carpaccio was beautiful to look at and beyond tasty. Like beyond. I could have easily had 5 more plates of it. It's not huge but it's a flavor bomb. The cauliflower was seasoned and prepared perfectly, and I don't really even like cauliflower. The rustic bread was happily smothered by me with the truffle butter that came along with it. Our finale was the spaghetti. Best spagetti, ever. Perfect homemade noodles, amount of sauce, meat chunks and adorned with the best mound of freshly grated parmesan cheese and herbs. Heaven.
When I go back, I need to try the bolognese next.
Shout out to Hugo, for his recommendations, his appropriate loud voice and his patience with me and my wine sampling and food allergy self.
restaurant_user_19_review:
We originally intended to come for restaurant week, not realizing that RW menu is only Sunday through Thursday (rookie mistake), but it actually worked out really well for us! We chose to explore some items that weren't on the RW menu and had a great experience. The place was still bustling at 8 PM (we had a reservation). Staff are super friendly and all-around great.
We were seated at what is essentially the chef's counter and had front-row seats watching the chef/owner cook. I was super impressed watching him cook for the whole restaurant in this tiny kitchen on a four-burner electric stove and being able to see the process made the food taste even better.
Food was delicious. We started with the clams, which were in a piping-hot, very mildly spicy tomato-based sauce. The picci amatriciana was, to quote my BF, the best tomato-based pasta he's had in the past couple of years. Seared scallops were also very good. Overall a great experience. Bar Cantinetta is a true neighborhood gem and I will definitely be back!
restaurant_user_20_review: The arancini and papardelle were so spicy that minutes after eating each, my mouth was on fire. I've had the papardelle before and it wasn't like this at all. I'm very sensitive to heat (spice) and nowhere on the menu was this change noted or listed. I would not have ordered it if I had known. Too bad, this dish used to be good, but it was so hot I couldn't even taste it. Really disappointed. Won't be back. Consistency matters, as do accurate descriptions. There's no need for arancini or papardelle bolognese to have that level of kick, definitely not what is expected or wanted.

restaurant_user_1_review:
I recently moved; was looking for a good place to eat nearby. Best place hands down in the neighborhood.
I have been there many times now and tried a lot of their specialty pizzas. All are really good.
But I'm a basic person. My pizza of choice is pepperoni. The owner there is very welcoming and hooks me up with the best pepperoni pizza every time. Extra pepperoni!!!!!
Love that I'm in walking distance.
restaurant_user_2_review:
Great service at this restaurant!!! Our server was very friendly and checked on us frequently.
My sister and I ordered a starter salad (large) and it was plenty for the both of us.
We each ordered our own pizzas which were prepared very quickly! Apparently their oven cooks pizza in 90 seconds! We were very impressed.
The pizza was cooked pretty well. I would've liked mine cooked a tad out longer since I prefer my cheese thoroughly melted. Other than that, the flavors were delectable.
I only ate 3 slices so I boxed the rest of my food.
Can't wait to eat my leftovers!!!
restaurant_user_3_review:
The pizza flavors were on point, but the execution was lacking. Very soggy middles on all of our pizzas. Soda beverages didn't taste quite right, and were then requested new ones. Wasn't any better, though the server said they should be fine even though they "couldn't" check the machines in the basement.
Service was ok...not great. Barely got a smile at the end, and we seemed to be a chore.
Not likely to return.
restaurant_user_4_review:
Pizzeria Pulcinella
Valoriani pizza oven
See Naples and die - or just trot over to Rainier Beach and have an authentic southern Italian pie!
According to their website, Pulcinella is brought to you by the same folks who own and operate Vince's. And, it has been "certified Neapolitan" by the Verace Pizza Napolitana Association since 2009.
The pizzeria is in a rustic building with high ceilings and expansive windows. The restaurant has a cozy feeI with table and bar seating, as well as a pizza counter where I grabbed a front row seat.stopped in on a rainy Wednesday night and was greeted by a friendly and helpful staff.
At the recommendation of Leo, the pizza maker, I decided on the Italian sausage and bell peppers appetizer ($10), which is given a brief roasting in the pizza oven and served in the cast iron skillet. Tasty, and the red sauce was hearty and flavorful.
Completing my order was the Giovanni pie - roasted pepper & pesto sauce, mozzarella, pepperoni, sausage, onion, crimini mushrooms, fresh tomatoes.
My server explained they would wait to put in the pizza order, because it bakes in just 90 seconds - and they weren't kidding. In fact, Leo, pointed out that part of their certification is a requirement to bake their pies to the 90 second mark - and - not a second more!
Molto autentico! I will try it again.
restaurant_user_5_review:
I'm gonna start by saying pizza is one of my favorite foods. I have been to over 20 pizza spots in Seattle and I have to say that this is one of my favorite places to get pizza. My eyes are tearing up just writing this review.
They make each pizza per order and they use fresh ingredients. The staff is nice and they have a lot of options to choose from. It has a very rustic pizza parlor feel and the dark wood interior and accents give it a real Italian vibe.
I got the Pozzuoli and when I tell you I inhaled this pizza I'm not lying. I don't even think it made it to the 5 minute mark. The crust was the perfect and there was not too much sauce on the pizza. The pepperoni was fresh and so were the mushrooms. It had the perfect bite and the pizza crust was good too. I have nothing negative to say about this place. I have been here 4 times now and each time has gotten better and better.
restaurant_user_6_review:
This is one of our frequent eateries. Most time we end up ordering multiple small plates/appetizer items. My mom favors their eggplant parmigiana. My favorite in the appetizer is their Caprese salad, tomatoes always seem to be flavorful and cheese fresh. My niece and nephew love their dessert chocolate pizza.
All items are house made, tastes fresh and flavorful. Staff is very nice and friendly.
Kid friendly
Street parking
Easily accessible
Unsure of compost/environmental friendly practices
***Would definitely recommend this place****
restaurant_user_7_review:
This place came highly recommended by a friend and it did not disappoint. It's a cute neighbor pizza place in what looks like someone's home from the outside.
Best thing about the food was 1) the pizza dough/crust 2) pepperoni, it's like seasoned or something but super good! We also tried the lasagna which was good with the ground meat being the highlight. I do still enjoy the pizza more though so I'd return for more of that. The weird thing to me was the middle of the pizza was super soggy. So I couldn't pick it up, but my friend says that's how pizza is in Naples. I cannot confirm or deny, so I'll take her word for it. The soggy part tasted fine though just usually not preferred.
restaurant_user_8_review: Terrible experience. Waste of time and money. Flavorless, soggy in the middle, and definitely shouldn't be called pizza. Really don't understand why it's rated so highly. Giving it two stars because our server was nice. Won't be going back.
restaurant_user_9_review: This place is fantastic!! Super authentic Italian pizza made in a wood fire pizza oven. You know it's authentic when you need a knife and a fork to eat it because the crust is so perfectly thin! And while we're on the crust... it's so delicious and crispy on the outside but chewy on the inside. Pizzeria Pulcinella seems to place a lot of weight in the quality of the ingredients - from the olive oils to the tomatoes used in the pizza sauce to the prosciutto di Parma on the pizza. This place is very cozy on the inside and the service is very friendly! Location-wise it's a little far out but definitely well worth the drive! Can't wait to go back :)
restaurant_user_10_review:
After reading several great reviews from people that have traveled to Italy or are Italian, I told my bf that we had to try this restaurant.
We went on Friday night and got there about 7:30 pm. The restaurant was packed. The only available seating was at the bar, which I thought was perfect. It sat us in front of the kitchen and it was the best view in the house.
The staff was very friendly and was attentive to us. We started with the Caesar salad, meatballs with marinara sauce and foccacia bread. Everything was great. We could have just been happy with ordering just that and dessert. But we also had to try the pizzas.
The timing of when our pizza came out to us was perfect. After we finished our appetizers, we didn't wait too long for it to arrive. It gave us enough time to digest our food. We ordered the Margherita and Diavola. The pizzas look amazing. I loved the taste, ingredients and the crust. I'm not a big fan of Margherita pizza, but this one was great tasting and I liked it very much. I love the spicy olive oil and the pepperoni in the Diavola pizza. The owner came to talk to us after our meal. We told him it was our first time and everything was great.
For dessert, we got the mocha decadence cake. It was amazing! Yuuuuuummmm.
I would definitely come back and bring my sister here, who's been to Italy, and see what she thinks.
Review to be continued...
restaurant_user_11_review:
We had our monthly Manhattan Mama's dinner out last night! This time it was a pizzeria! I apologize my pictures are not on point as we kept eating the food so quickly, it was great! We ordered clams, burrata platter, sausage with roasted peppers, salami and cheese board with marinated vegetables, Pulcinella salad, and the diablo pizza!
The owner Vince was there visiting with guests. He was very happy to see us and nice enough sent over a dessert! An amazing pastry filled with Nutella!
Definitely liked the vibe of the restaurant! It is cozy inside, decorated nicely, service was good and it got busy quickly. We found out the pizza oven was shipped straight from Italy. There is no real kitchen as the food is freshly prepared and stuck straight into the oven to be cooked.
One might drive by this little location if you didn't know any better so make sure you stop in and give it a try! We will be back for sure. Parking was easy and free!
restaurant_user_12_review: Really great charming roadside pizzeria and the staff is welcoming and helpful. We sat at the bar area to watch them make the fresh wood-fires pizza. We topped off dinner with a Nutella calzone for dessert and it was delicious.
restaurant_user_13_review:
THIS PLACE DESERVES ALL THE STARS!
Okay, now that I have your attention, I'll take it down a notch, although, I really shouldn't because they deserve as much;)
My husband lived in Italy for a few years while serving in the Navy and really fell in love with the food and the culture there. So while I was casually surfing Yelp I came upon this place, and the reviews that kept referring to its Italian authenticity. I knew I had to bring him here.
Like many others stated before, the place is on the small side. And parking can be a little rough. We got there at 7pm on a Friday night and it was busy. We ended up parking on the street next to the restaurant, it really wasn't that big of a deal. It definitely doesn't look like much on the outside, but you can tell with how paced it is, that its gotta be something special.
We went in and every table was taken. There were two spots at the bar that face into the open kitchen and we were totally fine with that. Gave us something fun to watch while we were waiting for our food. My husband was instantly in heaven once we were seated and we could take it all in. The decor, the set up, everything was "spot on", says he.
