Steak is very delicious but i think they may have a new chef who is still learning because the last time it tasted different and took a while but our server was extremely helpful and gave us free drinks due to the wait! My favourite place in seattle.
restaurant_user_10_review:
I have driven by this place for 20+ years and never gone inside! I used to go to the Montlake Alehouse next door, but that is no longer around. There was four of us on a Saturday night in March. The service was fast and the drinks and food came out quick. Nothing too complicated. The salads were basic, but people definitely ate them up. Pizzas are a huge part of the menu, so I ordered a sausage pizza.
I asked if they composted and the waitress said they did.
Good draft beer.
A warm, friendly environment.
restaurant_user_11_review: Homey spot for quality Italian food. The bread was a great combination of fluffy and chewy. Split the artichoke salad and the fettuccine with meatballs, which was a good amount of food for 2. Artichoke salad had lots of crunchy snap peas and texture but not a lot of flavor. Went for the meatballs because we saw praise for them online- they were tasty, not life-changing. We were pleasantly surprised by the quick and attentive service- they even brought out both the salad and the pasta split in two separate plates for us. 5 stars for service, 3 stars for food.
restaurant_user_12_review: I really really like Cafe Lago. The food is solid and it has a very good comfortable casually nice atmosphere. It may not be the most creative menu but I've been to places that sacrifice flavor for unique so, I'm ok with that. Their homemade bread is amazing! My husband and I like to go here when we just want a quiet night with good food.
restaurant_user_13_review: Solid restaurant with fresh pasta. Went here for a bday dinner for a party of 4. Easy place to get reservations when a lot of the other Italian restaurants in the city is almost impossible for a Saturday night. Easy parking. Quick and delightful service. I had lasagna and my boyfriend had the gnocchi, which were both good but not the best so more like 4 stars for me.
restaurant_user_14_review: I have to admit, I would never come here except my Airbnb is closed by and I definitely didn't ordered the right stuff. I had mixed salad - okay. Nothing special and I was craving steak. It came in a lump of burnt and slight over cooked on the outside. The insides was soft and delicious but most of the steak was chewy and hard to swallow. Disappointed. And the steak cost $30. Uff. Not coming back.
restaurant_user_15_review: We love this neighborhood gem. Fantastic pasta and pizza (thin crust) and tasty antipasto. Trust us- we lived next to Flour + Water in SF and dare I say this is better pizza. Our service was perfect- friendly and helpful. Very kid friendly too, so bring the family!
restaurant_user_16_review: Disappointing. The delay on food was over an hour and 10 minutes!!! The wait staff knew and was alarmed but nothing was done to offer us another glass of wine or even apologize. Once the food finally arrived the quality was good. But we didn't expect to sit with nothing for an hour in between the salad and main. Wow.
restaurant_user_17_review: Amazing I love this place. As an Italian food addict there are few Italian places that really stand out. Cafe lago has great lasagna and homemade fettuccini!! Super flavorful and definitely far from bland-- truly Italian done right. Also their cocktails are great too!
restaurant_user_18_review:
Unlike most restaurants, they don't charge for their tasty homemade bread and olive oil. Something that always irks my mom, a former NPR food commentator.
Appetizers (tapenade with Eggplant, tomatoes, and something else) and rabbit liver pate which my parents liked were good. Handmade white pizza with Chantrelles was good. Main entrees with venison (good) but overly cheesy lasanga (where's the beef?) and clams on a bed of spaghetti were adequate.
They earned back points for dessert.
Verdict: come back for dessert only or go to Vendemia in Madronna. Plenty of free street parking.
restaurant_user_19_review: Cafe Lago is delicious, but pretty expensive. $20-35 for each entree, and like $5 min for any non-alcoholic drink, is a little more than average but it's really good. Have come here plenty of times for birthdays or other celebrations since most dinners are min of $100. They hand make everything, I recommend their linguini with meatballs and definitely their Pomodori.
restaurant_user_20_review: Tried this restaurant on Friday night and it's so cute and quaint and quite the little neighborhood place. Had reservations at 5:45pm and by 6:15pm, the place was packed. The pizza was terrific. Had better gnocchi (it was good but the sauce was really thick). Husband liked his pasta dish with the meatballs. We had a very nice server; however, he could have been a little more attentive. When he did check on us, he was very professional and helpful. Will return for Pizza and salad -- can't wait!

restaurant_user_1_review:
Our experience at Bisato was amazing!! We were a four top and shared all plates. The Burrata was on of the most beautiful dishes I've ever seen. But then came the gnocchi, the yolk ravioli, and the ragu--Each so beautifully crafted, plated, and served. The flavors of these dishes were both familiar and completely new in the way they were prepared. I couLd not have told you what I was eating keg, but each item--each component--was so delicious and perfect together.
The service was impeccable. Just impeccable.
We started With the salumi. Ridiculously thinly sliced and delicious. We ate way too much focaccia b/c it was delicious and B/c the olive oil was the best we've had.
We cannot wait to go again!!!
restaurant_user_2_review:
Loved our experience at Bisato! Yes it is small portion but every dish was prepared perfectly. Really liked their creative touch on pasta (both tuna and uni) and the bass was also cooked just about right (arguably the best in seattle). The service was very good!
Would like to come back soon.
restaurant_user_3_review:
This has to be one of the finest restaurants in Seattle. Each course was perfectly executed. The ingredients married perfectly and were exquisitely plated. We had our server pair wines with each course and he nailed it!
The service was impeccable and enjoyable!
Put Bisato at the top of your next restaurant to try list!
restaurant_user_4_review:
It's hard for me to rate this place bc we maybe ordered wrong... everything we got was incredibly heavy or creamy that halfway through 2 (of 4) of us had to stop eating and let our counterparts finish the meal and we had to cancel a part of our orders.
We partook in:
- Salumi: incredibly delicious and beautifully, thinly cut. probably my fave of the evening.
- octopus: the octopus and the accompanying ice cream thing were delicious but I wasn't a fan of the hot pepper paste that came w it. Reminded me of Korean gochujang (hot paste) and there was a bit too much of it.
- foie gras: I had to ask for extra bread to eat this since this stuff is pretty fatty/greasy. Standard foie gras. I liked the sauce that came w it. Good balance.
- scallops (3): this was also quite Easy to eat and share since the scallops were pretty large in size
- savory fish tart w 3 minute egg and salmon roe: this was a bit too much for me and we got 2 to share amongst 4 people. If we could've done it again, we would've only gotten 1 to share bc this is super heavy, rich, and creamy. This was yummy tho for the first 2 bites but I had to stop after that.
- Dungeness crab: probably the lightest dish we had. Came w shredded crab meat in a pretty little tower of thinly sliced honey crisp Apple. Perhaps the best paired dish we got bc everything before and after was super heavy.
- gnocchi: the gnocchi is actually pretty large in size. Only comes out as 1 gnocchi but it can be shared. Again, this came w the hot paste that was reminiscent of Korean hot paste...
- tagliarini noodles: this was a bit of a let down. It comes w saffron noodles I think, lemon grass, and uni. We were told by our server to have it mixed, but I wish we didn't mix it. The lemongrass was overpowering and you couldn't taste the uni at all. Also, throughout the rest of the evening at dinner and home, we burped lemongrass.
Hand pasta: this is a wide, thin piece of pasta. It was super salty. Thankfully this came out w the veal chop which was not very seasoned, so eaten together they balanced each other out. But overall a bit of a let down.
- veal chop: this came out wo any accompaniments, so it was literally just a plate of sliced veal and the bone. Not salty enough, so pairing it w something salty or a veggie is a good choice.
Hmmm.... I think the food was okay, but either too seasoned or not seasoned enough.
Also, our server advised us to get 3-4 dishes per person, which I definitely think was too much. I think that would've made more sense if we were guided to get a well-balanced meal w light elements and rich elements, but we were not informed on what would be super heavy vs. what would pair well together. Everything we got was super heavy so it ended up being a hard meal for us to eat, plus we ended up canceling a portion of our orders bc it got so heavy halfway through. They didn't have a tasting menu when we went bc they said they were "in between" a transition or something.
The ambiance is lovely though, the coat check is great, and the open concept of the kitchen is cool. Def a cute date spot or place to grab a drink, but I wish they helped us balance our meal better w suggestions, which I'm pretty used to at other restaurants esp at this price point.
restaurant_user_5_review:
This is a late review, as I went for a dinner back in early August. It was for our anniversary celebration, just the two if us. We went on a recommendation from a friend. It was an amazing experience. The service was one of the best I've had in a long while. Attentive, very polite and respectful, and not intrusive at all. They answered all questions and helped us decide on a perfectly delicious wine. They were quite concerned because a light bulb above us kept flickering. They offered to move us, but we hadn't noticed it at all so decided it wasn't necessary.
We had just recently decided on becoming pescatarian, and there were plenty of delicious options for us. We tried 7 dishes, as I had done my research. In many reviews people had complained that the dishes were too small and they had left hungry. So I decided to order plenty. And we ordered more than enough as we both left very content, almost too full. Each dish, as you can see in the photos, was a work of art! Almost too good to eat! The service staff were very kind and explained each dish. I loved each one. Enjoyed all the flavors, and we didn't leave any leftovers. I can't remember which were my favorites as it has been too many months since my visit. But I remember that the whole experience was excellent. We left happy and very impressed. I HIGHLY recommend this place.
restaurant_user_6_review: Best service, delicious food and beautiful kitchen. Loved all aspects of it. Cute for date nights, business meetings or friends night out. Highly recommend and would rank this restaurant as one of my top 5 in Seattle. Will definitely come back.
restaurant_user_7_review:
Never got to try the original Bisato before it closed in 2012, but now that it reopened again, I so glad I got to try out the restaurant. Its an other amazing fine dining addition to the Seattle food scene, definitely not for everyone, but for those that are looking for a extra special meal for a celebration this is a great choice for it.
The location of Bisato is in a darkish corner of pioneer square with street parking available, if hard to get on a busy night. Walking inside, its an amazing space, it modern and inviting, not the standard industrial like space of most Seattle restaurant. There is a bar area that doesn't currently serve food, as well as table seating for what looks like 50 people. There is a great bright open kitchen that they invite you to look into, but the rest of the restaurant is fairly dark.
I went the tasting menu, though was very tempted by the chef choice option for an unknown price. The highlight of the meal for me was ravilolo filled with ricotta and a egg yolk, seems simple but everything about it was perfect. The chef even came by to serve it and cut the ravilolo to let the egg yolk spill out. Definitely a lick the plate kind of dish. Everything was very inventive, never would imagine a combination of crab and apples, or a scallop carpacio with salami. The dishes on the small side, even the a la carte option, so you are going to be spending quite a bit, but it totally worth it for me.
The service was great, they constantly was checking in on me, the water was always refilled, and the described all of the dishes well. The chef was always walking around and interacting with the guest, had a really cool conversation with him.
restaurant_user_8_review: This is a poem to food. Every bitE comes with love and care and so much thought. It was a lovely experience from walking in the door to the last bite of dessert.
restaurant_user_9_review: This place is amazing! My new favorite Italian in Seattle. I had the ravioli and it was to die for!
restaurant_user_10_review:
BISATO RE-OPENS IN PIONEER SQUARE
As a long time Seattleite I was fortune enough to dine at Chef Scott Carsberg's Lampreia and the original Bisato at 1st Avenue & Battery in Belltown numerous times; both world class restaurants! I am really excited that Bisato has re-opened in Pioneer Square (84 Yesler Way)!
The interior is warm and inviting with an open kitchen to watch the chef at work! And what a sight as you watch the kitchen staff work over an array of beautiful cured meats on the counter separating the restaurant from the kitchen. It opened in February and I have eaten there numerous times. Anything that the chef prepares is going to be an event. He adds new items to the menu on an almost daily basis, but also has some of his classics from his previous restaurants. And the service is world class!
It will be great for the neighborhood, but I think it will also be a destination restaurant for those seeking world-class cuisine!
Great to have you back Chef!!!!!
restaurant_user_11_review:
Several hours after enjoying a great meal at Bisato tonight, I just now realized what makes this new restaurant one of the most unique & interesting fine dining experiences in the PNW: it's a rare m√©lange of old school charm & attentive service mixed with some of the most modern, creative dishes I've seen/devoured in a long time.
The staff preparing and serving these artistic dishes are obviously very serious about what they do; but you can tell they also find joy in the collaborative effort.
We ordered about 12 dishes off the menu tonight, and all were fantastic. The real standout for me was the fish - in this case Bass served with Pistachio nuts and some fancy raisins.
A nice glass of Chianti and some crazy good chocolate tart helped seal the deal.
I can't wait to come back and try everything else!
restaurant_user_12_review:
Absolutely amazing experience. The service was done with precision, from the moment we stepped in the door. The attention to detail in every aspect of the decor, utensils, glassware was a wonderful compliment to show off the amazing dishes.
We enjoyed several items Chef Carsberg had on the menu (soft opening): hamachi crudo, radicchio salad, gnocchi, truffles pasta sheet, short rib, chocolate mousse and a surprise extra dessert (ice milk with chocolate soup).
I am still dreaming of the short rib, hamachi, both pasta dishes and the desserts.
Seattle is lucky to have Chef Carsberg back, leading a very talented team. I can't wait to come back after the official opening!
restaurant_user_13_review:
The food and service were wonderful. We tried the "Cook for Me Carsberg" omakase-style dinner, which came out to around $200 per person for nine courses. We felt that this was a great way to sample everything that the restaurant and chef had to offer, and we were blown away by the creativity exhibited in the dishes, as well as the exquisite and choreographed service. However, the dinner was very seafood-heavy, so we would not recommend for those with an aversion - although I'm not sure if this is intentional, or if it changes around the year. They are also very accommodating when it comes to dietary restrictions, so perhaps seafood allergies would have resulted in an entirely different meal.
The dining space felt very modern, and the open kitchen design allowed for guests to see their food being prepared - a nice touch. The restaurant itself isn't large by any means, but this resulted in a more personal atmosphere, and it was clear from the arrangement of the kitchen to the display of open and constantly-shifting beverages on central tables that this is meant to evoke a feeling of being at a dinner party.
Chef Carsberg stopped by our table several times over the course of the meal to check on how we were enjoying things, and even allowed us to enter the open kitchen afterwards for a quick conversation and picture with him, also making a point to ask for feedback on the dinner. Thus, a great meal culminated in an even more memorable experience.
restaurant_user_14_review: Great new restaurant! My husband and I randomly decided to stop in and give it a try. My husband had the tasting menu and I opted for a la carte. I appreciated that the whole table did not have to participate in the tasting menu. We enjoyed every dish. Some highlights included the wagyu beef special, dungeness crab with apple, and the gnocchi, and meat ragu with pur√©es potato. The chocolate mousse with orange confit was also delicious. Service was great - attentive but not overbearing. We will definitely return soon!
restaurant_user_15_review:
We brought two out of town guests (Tucson and Chicago) to Bisato last night - the former Trattoria Mitchelli location, but the interior improvements are nothing like the old TM. A beautiful space, with the open kitchen divided from the main dining area by a counter filled with beautiful cured meats. The service, from start to finish, was impeccable. I liked our server's style, but at times his desire to inform us felt a little pushy. I am not a fan of being told "you should order..", but it was low key. I also found it a little confusing to have so many off-menu items that he explained, but they got a bit lost in the lively atmosphere. This is a "hard surface" space, so my personal hearing issues can result in me losing a lot of the detail from a soft-spoken server.
Service of the food was top notch. All plates were set simultaneously and without any mix-up in who ordered what. Likewise, finished plates were quietly whisked away when we were done.
Food quality was amazing. Everything was perfectly prepared, artful presentations, original flavor combinations and a treat for palette and eye. We had a lot of fun sharing small tastes with each other. Portions are reasonable, maybe running small for big eaters, but Bisato is not about the volume of food one can consume. We tried the bass, steak and marinated black cod and everyone loved their food. The "hit" was the gnocchi - a nice fat dumpling topped, atop and aside many other creative ingredients and flavor pairings. The other hit for me was the asparagus soup - a bowlful of the taste of spring!
For us, having a fine dining establishment in Pioneer Square as an alternative to Il Terrazzo is wonderful. We can walk there from our office and we plan on entertaining more clients and business contacts soon. I am pretty sure Chicago and Tucson will know about this restaurant as our business contacts are sure to talk it up. The dress, by the way, is Seattle casual - no pretense here.
restaurant_user_16_review: AMAZING! I think this is my favorite Restaraunt in Seattle! The staff is personable, the chef is so polite he comes to see how you're meal is, they truly take care of you.
restaurant_user_17_review: Exceptional service, romantic ambiance, delicious food, incredible wine selection, and a creative chef. What more could one need? This place is like a hidden gem. One of the best dining experiences I've had in Seattle. I can't wait to return.
restaurant_user_18_review: My husband and I had dinner at Bisato a few weeks ago and the experience was one of the best of my life. Not only was the food fantastic, fresh, perfectly prepared, but not overly garnished, but the service was impeccable. The staff treated us so well I thought they might have got us mixed up with a food critic that was supposed to come in the same night. They were attentive without being over bearing and did a wonderful job with meal and wine suggestions. I can't wait to go back and bring friends!
restaurant_user_19_review: This is probably my favorite new restaurant in town. I had the tasting menu and each item was fantastic. The chef does a great job of coming up with creative, complex, dishes that are presented well and taste great. Looking forward to going there again.
restaurant_user_20_review:
Bisato is my jam! I had the chance to dine at Bisato several years ago in the old location and fell in love with it then. So I was really excited when I learned that it was coming back. Actually, I was worried that it might not live up to what I remembered. But having been a couple of times now in the new location I can say it has exceeded my expectations in every way. The new space is gorgeous. The service is refreshingly great (somehow low key but still exceptionally informed and attentive). And the food always astounds, which is not at all a surprise as the chef is never not there. This is my new favorite Seattle restaurant.
I've been really fortunate to have traveled extensively for work in Europe and Bisato always strikes me as one of the most authentically European dining experiences I've ever had in the US bar none. It's hard to explain but there is a tradition of respect for ingredients and food that is so apparent in the food here. It's interesting though to look through the reviews and to see a few who just don't get it. Which doesn't really surprise me because this guy is cooking as if his life depended on it and most people aren't used to that. It's like he's using a whole different language of cooking. This chef is old school but manages to make the food surprising and new at the same time.
This food is about ingredients and flavor, not about heaping, torso-sized American portions. It seems to assume that after you've had several bites of something your taste buds acclimate to those flavors and it doesn't surprise anymore. So why not finish it up and move on to the next thing that is going to dazzle you?! I've never left Bisato hungry so I don't understand some of the smack talk here. If you leave this place hungry then you're doing it wrong. Order more food! You won't be sorry. There is not a better value in restaurant dining in Seattle - no - America....than having this guy cook for you! We'll be going back often.

restaurant_user_1_review: Went to anniversary date with my husband. This is a wonderful place. Great service and food!
restaurant_user_2_review:
The F#*kt#rds at Yelp still refuse to remove this restaurant (or at least label it "CLOSED") even though it went out of business and closed it's doors 8 months ago......it's mind boggling.
See farewell letter from Facebook in attached picture
restaurant_user_3_review: I've had happy hour here twice and I've ate from their regular menu twice. I feel like they serve a very quality meal but I think portion size is a bit small for the price even though I know it's great quality but I feel like portion size could be a touch bigger. Service has always been good and again the food is always been delicious.
restaurant_user_4_review: Stopped in for lunch after work. Food was delicious and staff was friendly. The ravioli was taken off the menu which was one of the best dish there but everything else was still good. Unlimited bread which is a plus for us. I do think the price is a bit high from what I would expect and some dishes, the portion didn't quite make up for the price. But everyone in the group cleaned their plate so I can't complain there.
restaurant_user_5_review:
Very disappointing. We were in Seattle for over night and my wife noticed this place and said she thought they were top notch, high end Italian chain with great reputation.
WRONG!
the pricing was there but not the options or the flavor.
a bunch of weird dishes.
nothing normal Italian at all
my shrimp risotto had little tiny bay shrimp (almost as small as a can) in it.
my wife's pasta was to have a garlic wine sauce............but came with a red sauce.
not impressed
restaurant_user_6_review:
Great expectations. We have been to the Beverly Hills location and had very high expectations coming here. We walked in and waited at the Host Stand. Three employees, one of them a manager, walked up to the station, looked at a paper, turned and walked away. NOT ONE PERSON said hello or even made eye contact.
The waiter was more like a part timer. She was friendly, but was paying more attention to something else.
The food was mediocre at best. Not bad enough to complain about, but certainly not even close to Beverly Hills. The saving grace was the complimentary bread - it was Great.
The waiter realized that we got the short end of the service and brought us a complimentary dessert - which was wonderful but it was too late.
Il Fornaio has a great reputation - like I said the Beverly Hills location is AWESOME. But here in Seattle it was very disappointing and they charge the same prices.
restaurant_user_7_review:
I was pleasantly surprised by Il Fornaio, in terms of service and food options. My significant other and I came here for an early dinner and I was bit hesitant to try the place out, only because it's located in a mall. With that being said, it really is a great spot to wine and dine.
My partner and I ordered a pasta and pizza dish, so that we could both try each. I had the spinach ravioli, he had the pork sauce based pizza - the exact name is escaping me at the moment. Regardless, holy-moly they were so good! Great flavor for both entrees and we spoiled ourselves with dessert.
Our servers were very knowledgeable of wine pairings, as well as suggestion entree food options. I love leaving a restaurant feeling spoiled and well taken care of and that is exactly what I can say about this place.
restaurant_user_8_review:
Food: 6/10
Service: 4/10
Atmosphere: 6/10
Il Fornaio in Seattle is, unfortunately, pretty forgettable. It's possibly a touch above Maggiano's or Carrabba's, but there's not a lot to say about this location. They seem to be somewhat stuck between authenticity and Americanized Italian, and ultimately fall between the cracks as a result. I would think that, being so close to an oceanic coast and having so much fresh seafood available, the restaurant should focus on highlighting the advantages of its location (understanding that it is a small chain). Service was inattentive and could easily have sold my group some appetizers, but seemed more interested in watching the bread cook and gossip, so we didn't indulge.
restaurant_user_9_review: Restaurant is beautiful. Staff is very helpful, professional and attentive. I was not surprised by the prices, however, I was surprised by the food. The entrees had by my husband and myself were so bland. That coupled with the crazy price tag was a huge disappointment. They did have an amazing dessert which we enjoyed. Unfortunately, I would not recommend this restaurant, nor do I plan on going back.
restaurant_user_10_review:
Made a reservation for 8 and the host asked me if it was a special occasion. I told him that it was a "why yes it was, my in-laws 50th wedding anniversary" When we arrived I reminded the host that it was a 50th wedding anniversary. They walked past the center table set for 8 and stuck us in a corner next to the kitchen. (That other table was finally filled with 6 people about an hour later). I think they looked at our mixed race family (white, black and Hispanic) and judged us that we shouldn't be in the center of their nice space. Another AA couple was stuck in a corner.
The waiter was nice but didn't say happy anniversary or talk to my in-laws at all even though I told him that we were celebrating such a big event. The host did not seem like he was making it special as I hoped the waiter would.
After we ordered appetizers, drinks and dinner (they forgot my steak knife and made my husband get up to finally get me one because my butter knife wouldn't cut it-I happily tried) the waiter asked if we wanted dessert. I said yes and he brought me a menu. I finally asked, do you do anything for "special occasions because you guys asked me if it was and marked it on our reservation?" He said 'oh yeah. We could give you a spamoni gelato ' ok. So I ordered a few more desserts so we could all share some.
Not once did this restaurant make our special occasion special. I told the young, dumb and broke host that his table choice was rude. We might not look like we are well off or tip well but we DO and even if we didn't it's their integrity in their service, (btw-I tipped 20% because it was work to serve 8 people and I'm not rude). Also my medium rare steak was not red at all in the center. I didn't want to dampen the night. I will be calling the manager but I doubt he/she cares. We shall see if they even respond on Yelp.
Update : the manager doesn't seem to care that we came for a 50th wedding anniversary nor that they asked but treated us like we should be sat by the kitchen and not treated kindly or like the special occasion that it was. My in-laws are the kindest people. Too bad no response. Changed from 2 to 1 star 2/5/19 after no response from the manager.
restaurant_user_11_review: I really enjoyed my meal at Fornaio! A huge part due to the fact that our waiter was really kind and personable from the moment we walked in. For example, he offered to put parmesan on our pizza and checked in on us the right amount. The wine I had was really delicious and the pizza was good. I'm not giving the full five just because the food we had wasn't spectacular, but the service was so great that I would definitely come again!!
restaurant_user_12_review:
horrible service shitty food
How does one order delivery for a pizza with a salad and only gets the salad !!???? Had to wait 1 hour for my cold ass shitty pizza .... when they live 5 blocks away??!! Ridiculous
The only good thing is they returned my money for just the pizza because they know they weren't going to get away with this .
restaurant_user_13_review:
I once turned down a date here because I was like, "Uh, a mall restaurant? Gross." My loss, because now I've finally eaten here I realize not all mall restaurants are created equal.
We came in on the late side for dinner, and our server was very nice and flexible with our annoying orders and additions--lactose intolerance, type 2 diabetes, just a lot of special dietary needs.
Ended up trying the cucumber cooler cocktail, Margherita pizza, Caesar salad, meat ravioli, and goat cheese flatbread appetizer. Family got the white chicken rigatoni pasta and the seafood sampler dish, which came with two kinds of fish, shrimp, calamari, and a veggie side. The dishes are expensive--more than 20 a pop so it adds up fast, but they were relatively good. I say I'd probably skip the ravioli next time. The pasta was too firm and there weren't enough to warrant 22.50 price tag. Since every main is about the same price, I feel like even the white chicken pasta bowl was a better deal.
The flatbread was good. Crisp and topped with tomatoes and red onion. Cucumber cocktail was weak. The best looking dish was the fish sampler. Pizza is typical Neapolitan, so soggy/soft and wasn't the best leftovers. Their bread and oil/vinegar is delicious--the bread has a great crust and the inside is so tender...it's delicious and wonderful for sopping up extra sauces from your main.
Overall I was happy with dinner and I'd come back to try other food and have wine over cocktails.
restaurant_user_14_review: I walked in to a dining room that was more than half empty on a Friday evening at 7pm (which was the first warning sign) and was told there would be a ten minute wait. Why? Unacceptable. No reason to turn down business when there are plenty of empty tables. I looked at the dining room, then looked at him like he was nuts - but he offered no explanation. Perhaps the host did me a favor by letting me walk out, without any offer to stay not even for drink at the bar. I honestly wouldn't mind a wait under 15 minutes, but there was no justification for this. I have never wrote a review without tasting food first, but will do so whenever I receive piss poor, uncaring service like this, especially without even sitting down.
restaurant_user_15_review:
We were very impressed by this restaurant during our visit there yesterday.
We had a sleeping child in a stroller and were looking for somewhere we could take the stroller, unfolded, inside. They were completely understanding on this point and seated us in quiet corner with our stroller.
My butternut squash ravioli with fried sage leaves was excellent. The dish featured large, soft, homemade pillows of pasta and there was a circle of very fresh tomato sauce in the middle. They kept the fried sage leaves out of the sauce so that they were crispy and easily paired with a bite of ravioli. I especially loved that touch.
My husband's Tagliatelle Bolognese was very good as well.
Lastly, we were very impressed by the kindness of the staff. We would definitely make another visit in the future.
restaurant_user_16_review:
We've been here twice so far, it is close to Paramount and we park in the same building anyway. I'd love to give them a 3.5*, but I feel 3 is too low and they are not quite a 4.
We both had pasta and pizza both times, I wasn't too impressed with the pizza the last time, this time around was better. We both really enjoyed their pasta dishes (Penne vodka and butternut squash with brown butter and sage). We also decided to order an appetizer salad plate, which was nice, but could have used a little more something. It was plain lettuce with some parmesan shavings, I think a couple of tomatos, olives and other items could have added to it. The salad was too simple for the price we paid.
Service is always slow, we got seated and someone brought us water, another person a basket of bread and than no one else came for about 15-20min at least? We didn't know who our waiter was, so we emptied the bread basket and were just about done once the waiter showed up. He seemed stressed, even though there wasn't too much going on yet when we arrived.
Overall a decent option, but it isn't the high end italian experience I was hoping for.
restaurant_user_17_review:
I have been to this location a few times now with my aunt and uncle and I have actually been to the one in Coronado in San Diego. I have always had good experiences.
The first time we went to this location, we sat at the bar section and had happy hour. Which for food, is a pretty good of $6 apps and pizzas.
Went here again last night and dined in their dining room right next to the dessert cart!
We ordered:
- squid ink pasta with salmon, shrimp, clams, and mussels $23
- risotto
- calamari
- mixed charcuterie board
The squid ink pasta was pretty good! It was my first time trying squid ink pasta and I really enjoyed it. the sauce was light and their was plenty of seafood in the dish.
With a Yelp check-in you get a free order of calamari! Score! Overall, we had a good time.
restaurant_user_18_review: Stopped in for lunch, wasn't busy but food was great. Had the pizza, minestrone, and seafood appetizer. Waitress was very attentive and seafood was fresh. The pizza was perfectly thin and had a great cheese to sauce ratio. Would love to stop back by for pasta.
restaurant_user_19_review: Exploding tomatoes, Imported pasta, and brilliant italian minds providing a cerebral flavor overdrive. Tastes so hardcore, speed noming behaviors were grounded into a fine halt and dragged for a meticulously hour long flavor marathon. My grinding machines set to slowpoke to insure every biting sequence was celebrated for cerebral satisfaction. Il Fornaio concocted such a masterpiece, my food resume set a new record for slowest meal eaten.
restaurant_user_20_review:
Run - do not walk - away. This place has turned into a complete dump! The food is ridiculously overpriced for what it is trying to pander to tourists. And the flavor was "Meh."
The restaurant is worn. Walking upstairs to use the bathroom I noticed a terrible stench coming from the carpeted stairs that have clearly never been cleaned.
Bench seats and repairs with duct tape. Slivers abound with the worn tables. And they no long validate parking.
It's a dump. Don't bother.

restaurant_user_1_review:
After visiting Carmines in Downtown Bellevue again for my birthday I can say that it is truly one of the best dining experiences in the Seattle area.
The service is always friendly and welcoming, professional but not pretentious. They always greet with a smile and take your coats to hold while you dine. The servers think of every detail, are very knowledgeable, and truly want you to enjoy your experience.
Their food is incredible. I always get the fennel sausage pasta with a vodka cream sauce, I have a hard time ordering anything else! I started with the charred romaine salad which is also very tasty. The crispy pancetta on top is a nice touch.
My husband tried the crab risotto special and I don't think I've ever seen him enjoy and savor any other food ever!
They even gift you a biscotti when you leave to continue enjoying your meal the next day with your morning coffee
If you're looking for a spot for your next celebration, date night, or if you just want to feel a little fancy, Carmine's is the spot!
restaurant_user_2_review:
Food- very good Italian food. Portions are modest to fair, will fill you to content unless you order an additional salad , side or dessert. The bread is amazing crusty outside soft inside ciabatta from Central Market Seattle (per bus boy). I got the cioppino northwest, which was piping out with yummy seafood tomato broth. The gulf shrimp were huge and white fish buttery. Husband got the white clams linguini, which was delicious, wish it had more pasta, but we asked for 2nds on bread to sop up the yummy sauce. Rigatoni Bolognese is classic and nothing to rave or complain about, I would order it again as comfort food. The insalata di mista was seriously just greens, no tomatoes, cucumbers or additions. They will substitute the dressing to a lemon vinaigrette which was solid.
Service- very good!! Attentive servers who I feel like are real Italian. Server kindly split out salad order and kids order to 2 plates.
Ambiance- I categorize as upscale rustic Italian, with the chandeliers, white table cloth, exposed beam ceilings. Beautiful entry way flowers and landscaping decorations. They have nice velvet booths and large chairs. Great for a date, celebration to celebrate, not ideal for rambunctious kids. Goes well with the Italian theme, and the restaurant name itself.
Location- across from downtown park. Street parking.
Value- fair, you pay for the whole package, of service and ambiance.
Recommend- yes.
restaurant_user_3_review:
MUST GET THE STEAK. I know they're an italian restaurant and you may feel the need to get their pasta... but i'm telling you this place should become a fancy steakhouse because their steak is damn good. I had 3 of the pasta dishes this night and all of them combined did not live up to expectations and flavour. But I highly highly recommend the steak. I think you get the point.
Also, one of THE best dining experiences here in terms of fancy restaurants regarding service and atmosphere ! So that's a plus plus plus!
restaurant_user_4_review:
Carmine's is a beautiful restaurant for a date night! The atmosphere is incredible and the service is always wonderful. Prices can be high, but if you go with a vegetarian option and get drinks elsewhere, it can definitely be an affordable date. I always get the fettuccini al pesto without prawns. Although parking can be tricky, and it does tend to get crowded in the evenings, the food is definitely worth it.
I highly recommend choosing Carmine's next time you are looking for an upscale restaurant to grab a bite.
restaurant_user_5_review: One of the best fine Italian restaurant in the region. Nice selection of delicious dishes. Everything from pasta to Salmon was good. Of couse, they have a fabulous wine list. A little expensive but worth it.
restaurant_user_6_review:
Made a reservation thru open table and requested a quiet table for boyfriends birthday.
We arrived and the table had a happy birthday card welcoming us. Wait staff was attentive. Made our selections on dinners and it was served in a timely manner and it was still piping hot. Veal scallopini was delicious with caper sauce. Halibut was tasty as well. Also ordered the fettuccine gluten free and it was very tasty with great texture and flavor. Squid ink seafood was awesome with a little bite of heat. All and all a great place for food and very classy.
We were even presented with free birthday dessert to finish off our meal.
Our waiter Brett was awesome too. Humorous, patient and engaging. We will return for more great food and good service.
Upon exiting the restaurant we were giving biscottis to take home wrapped up pretty.
restaurant_user_7_review:
Worth the $$$! Great service, great food!
This place gets packed so highly recommend making reservation.
At a friend's recommendation, we went here for my birthday. Love the small details they do -- a handwritten happy birthday note card on our table and the staff's "happy birthday" greetings as they walk past our table.
For starters we had:
Calamari Fritti Fried squid with spicy marinara and lemon aioli, topped with fresno peppers $16
Bruschetta Trio: Black pepper, goat cheese, and tapenade Avocado, smoked salmon, and Cr√®me Fraiche $21
The calamari fritti was crunchy and seasoned well. It was not oily at all. The Bruschetta was delicious as well. I recommend these 2 starters.
I had the Zuppa Del Giorno - Daily special seasonal soup $12 - which was seafood chowder. Yumm! Ingredients were fresh and very tasty!
For Main we had:
One of the day's special: Asparagus risotto with fried soft shell crabs. 2 pieces of nicely deep fried whole soft shell crabs on top of asparagus risotto.
Squid ink Capellini Di Mare Angel hair pasta tossed with fresh tomatoes, prawns, mussels, calamari and Manila clams Lg $28 Sm $21 -- the large size is good for sharing.
Costata Di Maiale - Double cut bone-in Pork chop with apple-pancetta chutney and risotto. $39
All three main were very good and I recommend all of them. The surprise was how good the pork chop was! It was juicy and tender. Very tasty!
For dessert we had tiramisu and gelato.
The staff were great -- very attentive. It's what you'd expect from a fine dining place but with a more relaxed atmosphere.
restaurant_user_8_review: Carmine's in Bellevue is one of the more popular Italian restaurants in the area. Definitely helps to get a reservation in advance unless you sit at the bar top. The food is great - high quality ingredients and simple, while still flavorful. I liked the Gnocchi more than the Bolognese which I got last time. Both are food, but this Gnocchi was really good! Only knock on the place was the service at the bar... not as warm and welcoming compared to being at a table.
restaurant_user_9_review: Oh my goodness! One of the best pasta dishes I've ever had... I'm lactose intolerant but this did not hurt my stomach.
restaurant_user_10_review: A marvelous cozy New York style Italian eatery with a lovely bar and fantastic help and every dish we tried was better than the next. I recommend Carmine's to any visitor to Washington even if you have to drive it was worth every penny even though it was way more than that! the meat dishes were so tender in your mouth, the bread was crisp, the pasta was as good as it gets! The gnocchi melted in your mouth in soft pillowy bites! The wine menu was outstanding and the dessert was great! What more can Say? GO
restaurant_user_11_review:
Oh my goodness. I don't even know where to start. This is literally my favorite restaurant in Bellevue!! It is located in old main, very cute and calm area. I posted 2 photos of the chicken entree that my boyfriend and I always get. Those pics were taken two different times, and as you can see, they switch up the veggies!!
My go to is the pesto fettuccine and the rigatoni bolognese. I always get the large size which is around $25!! I can't say enough good things about this place. The vibe at the restaurant is fancier than most. And the wine is good too!!
restaurant_user_12_review:
Want delicious Italian food, elegant ambience and patrons dressing up for dinner? Then look no further than Carmine's in Bellevue.
I came here on a Friday night with a group of women to celebrate a birthday and we all dressed up. Reservations definitely needed as it was completely full.
had the complimentary bread, Caesar salad for an appetizer, risotto for my main and tiramisu for dessert. Every item tasted fresh and cooked beautifully.
We had fantastic service and felt it was a perfect restaurant to celebrate a special occasion. It's definitely pricey so I'll come here again for another special occasion.
You can park on the street or at Downtown Bellevue Park or pay for the valet service.
restaurant_user_13_review:
Taste- *****
Ambiance- *****
Parking- ****
Service- *****
Carmine's is my favorite Italian restaurant on the eastside. Great food, great ambiance, and amazing service. This is a great place for date night and to celebrate special occasions. It's a little pricey, but 100% worth it. Will return time and time again.
restaurant_user_14_review: Each bite of the brown sage gnocchi was so good! I would definitely recommend having this dish if visiting. One large dish is the perfect amount and will leave you feeling satisfied and sad that there's no more once finished.
restaurant_user_15_review:
The Service really makes up for anything at this establishment.
Best service ever!
Everyone that helped us (I counted about 5 people randomly attending us without care of section or status) were so detail oriented and helpful! They even did a "Split and Marry" with our selection of food as well since we were sharers.
The food was above average but nothing fantastic was my take away for quality of food. The price was to be expected and average for fine dining.
The atmosphere and architecture setup of the restaurant was on point to deliver the feel of quality without compromising a warm welcoming feeling. I felt comfortable and very accommodating. I have been to many places where I felt like I didn't fit in or the staff would look down on me for being a muggle in a fancy place. I never felt like that at this amazing dining experience! It felt like going to a chef's home in which you were good old friends.
Really, service was over and beyond amazing. I obviously can't say this enough. Thank you!
restaurant_user_16_review:
I really like the Carmine's set up and operation. The atmosphere is great, the service is above average. The food from pasta to seafood to steaks are always on the point. I had dinners and lunches here on different occasions. My favorite dish is the squid ink pasta and desserts. My family enjoys the warm bread ad butter every time.
The only two things I wish...
-Dinner time is very noisy no matter it is weekdays or weekend. It is hard to talk at my own table. I prefer to come on the weekday for a late lunch.
-I wish to have the squid ink pasta not the angle hair style. I want a thicker texture than the thin hair.
Otherwise, this will be my rare 5 stars review in Bellevue, Wa.
restaurant_user_17_review:
I can't wait to go back!
The evening started off a little rough since we weren't able to get in at our 8:30pm res time, but we got to sit in the entry and watch all the interactions. You can tell that everyone in this restaurant truly cares about what they do, know their stuff, and want to ensure each guest feels special and taken care of.
Once we were seated, they sent over a comp app for our extended wait - and it was delicious. Our server made sure any requests we had were taken of, and we really felt cared for. The food was absolutely delicious - from the app to the entree to the dessert!
restaurant_user_18_review:
We had an excellent dinner at Carmine's. The decor was nice, parking was easy to find (surprisingly), service was great, ambience was excellent (we sat outside where it had sort of a Parisian cafe feel).
I ordered the Fettucine al Pesto con Gamberoni and my friend had the Squid Ink Pasta. Both were delicious especially the prawns that came with it.
The price also wasn't too bad for an upscale Italian restaurant. Two entrees and two cocktails came out to $100 after a 20% tip.
restaurant_user_19_review: Ambiance is superb and the service was above expectations, i found my spaghetti a little bland though. Overall great experience w/a killer cosmo!
restaurant_user_20_review: Top notch service!!! Came to this restaurant with my girlfriend! We both are vegetarian and had decent options on the menu! We started off with burrata and soup. I had the cauliflower soup and my gf had tomato soup! Both the soups were creamy and delicious. For main course we ordered a gnocchi in marinara sauce and angel hair pasta in sage butter. Both the pastas were good. We finished our meal with tiramisu, Panna cotta and some coffee! Everything was perfect and as mentioned earlier service is outstanding!

restaurant_user_1_review:
Came here because it was raining hard and we were staying at the Hyatt. Gotta say we were pleasantly surprised. Wife loved her cocktail, and we both really enjoyed the carne pizza. It was excellent. If you want a light dinner, one pizza for two people is a good choice.
We also shared a chocolate mousse for dessert. It was pretty good, but a bit too heavy for my wife. I, the chocolate fiend, was very happy with it.
restaurant_user_2_review:
I was pleasantly surprised by Andar√©. It is one of the restaurants in the Hyatt Regency and is reasonably priced for the quality of food. I tried the Trofie pasta and the grilled salmon. I was a big fan of the pasta which was made with a pesto sauce based with pistachio. I would recommend this for the pesto lovers out there. Unfortunately the salmon was not impressive. It was a bit over cooked and didn't taste very fresh. The bread service ($3) comes with a decently sized warm load and olive oil/vinegar.
Andare is the more casual one restaurant if the hotel on the first/lobby floor. This being said it does have a nice ambiance and is more casual nice than casual, but most people are dressed very casually.
restaurant_user_3_review:
Absolutely outstanding! Ken was a fantastic bartender. All of his wine and food choices were stellar! The small bite appetizer meatballs (which I would normally never order) were so good, I almost asked for a private moment.
The homemade pasta with pistachio pesto was a dream for my tastebuds! Truly amazing!
Ken was attentive, but not intrusive. Funny. Perfect night! : )
restaurant_user_4_review:
Love their new dishes - Shrimp scampi with fried risotto. The shrimp were 3 tiger shrimp that cooked just right. The risotto was a bit heavy cuz it was fried with heavy cream. Still delicious!
I ordered the Mango cucumber mule was a bit sweet so I asked for extra ginger beer.
Panna cotta for dessert. A bit disappointed as I can tasted it was not made fresh at the daily basis. I ate half.
Service was great. My waitress came over a few times to check on me.
Note that they added 20% gratitude to the bill.
restaurant_user_5_review:
We stopped in here for a drink last weekend. It was in the morning so we were the only ones in the bar.
For one, the bar is super cute! I loved it right when I walked in.
Two, our bartender was AWESOME!! It was super slow and we were only getting a drink so he could've brushed us off but he was the total opposite!
So nice and friendly! Quick service and we just chatted about the city. It was such a great experience that we're going back for dinner soon.
His name is Alexander and he is great! Seriously, go see him! More industry people need to be like him! Nice, friendly and welcoming!
restaurant_user_6_review:
How I wish to give Andare 5 stars because the staff consistently go out of their way to provide great service. I've visited several times for a quick dinner, bite to eat at the bar and for take out. The selection since the opening December '18 has remained the same and is limited albeit quite varied flavor wise - i.e., it doesn't appear they gave specials or a rotating menu. The food quality is very decent overall except for the pasta dishes where it appears that the management cuts corners with the ingredients.
Options cover a nice range from pizza to sandwiches. Taste tends towards spicy. The service in the main restaurant area is a bit different - place an order at the entrance through a tablet (someone is there to type it in for you), then wait for your food and drinks to arrive at a table of your choice. A 20% service charge is apparently no longer automatically included.
Noise level is average to loud depending on how many enthusiastic conference attendees are dining with you. Music tends to be 80s pop, not such a great choice for dining.
restaurant_user_7_review:
I had the opportunity to attend a food tasting here and wow, I'm so glad I got to try more than I thought I would.
We started off with some cocktails. I forget the name (blood orange pellegrino?) but it was def strong considering we're here during lunch. It had a grapefruit or an orange which added a nice citrus taste. They serve with ice and a side of tonic water which when you add it to the drink, it turns the color to purple! It's original color is blue from butterfly pea.
For the appetizer, we started off with Caesar salad and their signature Andare salad. Both were light full of flavor! I especially love the lemon vinaigrette on the Andare salad! We also got to try the Andare signature meatballs and wowwww that was really good! The meatballs were so tender and the grilled pizza bread was so soft and chewy! Fantastic dish and a must try!
We then were served their signature cavatelli and fettuccine carbonara! Both were amazing and I loved the whip ricotta on top of the cavatelli! It added a nice creaminess to the overall taste! The carbonara was slightly too salty for me but man I couldn't stop myself from eating more of it! Love the addition of the egg yolk which added a velvety consistency to each bite!
Then moving onto more carbs-4 different types of Pizza!!! We tried their duck, prosciutto, mushroom, and margherita! All of them were fantastic but my fav was the prosciutto and mushroom! They were so full of flavor and the prosciutto pizza had a soft egg on it!! The duck was a close second while margherita is last just because I had it before! Their pizza is thin crust, making it easier to consume after all the carbs from the pasta lol
Lastly dessert! We tried their cannolis and gelatos. The cannolis has a strong cinnamon taste to; kind of reminds me of a Mexican chocolate cookie. The cherry jam added a nice sourness which helped with the sweetness!
We tried three diff flavors of gelato: pistachio, hazelnut, and berry. My personal fav was the hazelnut! It was so nutty and rich! The pistachio didn't have a strong enough pistachio flavor but it was still good! The berry was more like a sorbet kind of flavor but had a gelato creaminess consistency. It's served with fresh berries and a slice of lemon bar or some kind of bar.
Overall I had a fantastic experience here and I would really like to thank our host Tim who did an excellent job hosting and informing us about the restaurant and food!
Interesting fact: Andare means "On the go" in Italian! The restaurants concept is to be like a fast casual restaurant!
restaurant_user_8_review:
This place was an option for lunch on my lunch app so I decided to check it out and was pleasant surprise. This is located in the new Hyatt hotel and is consider more of a sit down fancy lunch rather than a quick to go lunch. However, this place exceeded my expectations for a quick lunch.
I ordered the chicken salad and when I arrived, it was ready in a nice paper bag. The lady saw me arrive and had it ready for me to grab. When I open the box, I was pleasantly surprise as well. The chicken was a generous portion and was juicy and tender. The salad was filled with artichoke, pistachio and cheese. All the ingredients was fresh and high quality. For the price, this is a really good deal.
Would definitely come back to try other things for lunch. This place is new so they are trying to promote their restaurant and they are doing a pretty good job at it. They also have happy hour as well.
restaurant_user_9_review:
Finally got the chance to try Andare after a failed office lunch attempt where the building's fire alarms booted us. In natural fashion, we went back as an office for Happy Hour, because we were all still dying to try.
The ambiance is light, bright, open, chic and casual. The bar was full so we sat in the main dining area, where we were still able to order off of the Happy Hour Menu. Drinks for the table ordered: Manhattan, Aperol Spritz (only because NYT recently dissed them and we've never tried), Castleventrano Martini, and a great Red Wine pick from the bar manager. One of my coworkers knows what she wants in terms of taste of her wine, and they did a spot on job picking one out. All of the drinks were delicious and came out fast.
For food we ordered the Charcuterie Platter, Signature Meatballs & the Tuscan Bean and Kale Soup. Let me start with the Charcuterie platter, they say it is for 2, it's not, there were 4 of us and we barely finished it. It had a beautiful assortment of cheeses, meats, olives, veggies, etc. Everything was delicious. The meatballs (full order has 8 good sized balls), they were so flippin good. They do have a bit of spice to them, but I loved that part. Juicy, tender and an amazing sauce to dip the flatbread. The soup was delicious as well, jam packed with beans, kale and sausage goodness.
All in all, we all left satisfied. Service was amazing as was the rest. Will definitely be back to try some more dishes.
restaurant_user_10_review: I was staying at the hotel, and decided I wanted some late night food to eat, so I came down to the bar area. The bar area has a limited menu, but I just wanted a pizza, so that was fine. The bartender was very friendly and nice. After waiting a long time there (35 minutes?), the bartender checks on the food, and they forgot to make it. The food then came out quickly. On the plus side, I got the food for free. However, it took a long time. It was a margherita pizza which was, meh. So overall, my experience was not great.
restaurant_user_11_review: I live local but I was attending a convention over the weekend and stopped by the bar several times. Ken was terrific and super friendly, made some bomb drinks for us. The atmosphere was really nice, a lot of Christmas lights already in the hotel lobby. The mischievous meatballs were also really tasty!! Overall an incredible experience all weekend.
restaurant_user_12_review:
Here on a chilly evening and I couldn't have asked for a better comfort food meal. The carbonara and signature meatballs were delicious. The carbonara was creamy and sumptuous with crispy pancetta and the meatballs had just the right amount of spice to add balance.
Staff was attentive and friendly.
restaurant_user_13_review:
Met a friend at Andare for lunch, and it did not disappoint! I had the carbonara which was phenomenal! My friend had the antipasto salad and meatballs on the side! She enjoyed both her dishes as well! Then for dessert we ordered the pistachio gelato and cannoli, both were great!
It's a beautifully designed restaurant inside of the Hyatt Regency. You order and pay before you sit down which makes it a great place to go for lunch if you work near by. The service was quick and good. We didn't get drinks this time, but it looked like they had a great bar and happy hour as well! Will definitely be coming back!
restaurant_user_14_review: Tried to go here...closed except lobby and bar. My kids were with me, so we ended up going to the lobby. We were ignored, so we left.
restaurant_user_15_review: Great place for HH! We came in on a wed at 4:30pm and needed to table for 8. Got in quickly and the waiter said they would split checks. (Big plus!) the happy Hour Menu has a good menu selection with $8 pretty big pizzas and $4 meatballs that came with some naan like bread- very good! Overall enjoyed this experience and will def be back for more HH dates and try dinner. A must try in the area. Great food and service! Bar area was pretty packed though, so def there early if you want to be in the bar area. HH is in bar area and front of restaurant.
restaurant_user_16_review: Ordered the Carne Pizza. Not bad, a little on the pricier side though. Restaurant itself is a solid, modern feel. Not sure if this happens to everyone, but I had to pay a 20% service charge.
restaurant_user_17_review: I had high hope for this place and was in the mood for pasta carbonara. The service was not very welcoming at all. I stood there and waited for the person to look up and greet me before I could get a table. I was put off on the side. The waitress asked if I wanted anything other than water, but I wasn't given a drink menu. She seemed inconvenienced to go get one, but she did. I asked her if there was a smaller version of the salad to eat as a starter. She said I could get a side salad, so that's what I ordered. When it came to my table she stopped and ask if it was a good size in a patronizing fashion. The salad was served in too small of a bowl and difficult to eat. It didn't have much flavor and the lettuce was very watery. Before I got half way through the salad my pasta carbonara arrived. The person just laughed when she saw I still had half a salad and then walked away. The carbonara looked delicious but fell short on taste. It mainly tasted of garlic. It really needed some cheese which is important for a carbonara. I don't think I'll be coming back here.
restaurant_user_18_review: Had an amazing lunch with coworkers and can't say enough good things about the service! Ken was attentive and extremely accommodating. Definitely went above and beyond!
restaurant_user_19_review:
Basic and Dependable Grab n Go Italian. The Andare Bar (AB) is a hilight. Excellent Service.
Fine but 22 bucks plus 20% or 28 bucks per drink is outrageous.
restaurant_user_20_review: The bartender was great and accommodated my request to customize my drink as I was intrigued by an item on the menu, but am not a gin lover. 3 stars because none of the food items/drink items that were pictured (reasons why we came to this bar) were available or on the menu here. I was looking for the delicious carbonara and color changing drink, but was nowhere to be found! Color me disappointed, we only had one drink each and left quickly.

restaurant_user_1_review:
I've been going here since I was a kid. The best pasta, pizza, Italian food you will try in Seattle. Seriously.
At such a reasonable price, this is why their lines are always out the doors and are sometimes an hour wait during their peak times. Just come prepared! :)
You truly can't make a mistake on their menu. I've tried a whole bunch of their pastas and have never been disappointed. Their pizzas, wow. The dough they make is just so perfect. That is why their bread that comes out with butter is phenomenal. All made in-house.
You walk in and it feels like a small little restaurant. Nothing fancy and that is the best part of it! You are truly here for the food.
restaurant_user_2_review:
OH MY GOD.
YES.
Honestly go, it'll make you a better person.
Everything we've ordered has been amazing from the chicken parm to the life-changing carbonara. Staff is always delightful and they really know their stuff when it comes to wine-pairings and dish recommendations.
Couldn't recommend it enough.
restaurant_user_3_review:
OMG!!!!!!!
Let's be honest. There are a number of Italian restaurants but it's hard to find a really good spot. Ladies and gentlemen this the spot. I can't believe this place has been under my nose and never visited. I love the neighborhood vibe as soon you walk through the door. It's not small but it's not super big.
I always like to give places the lasagna test because and as easy as it seems to make, I've encountered some horrible tasting lasagnas. This lasagna was hands down some of the best I've ever tasted. Everything about it was perfect. On top of everything the prices were very reasonable.
This place is definitely a gem and a must visit for authentic Italian.
restaurant_user_4_review:
The smell of garlic was in the air as we entered the large dining room and we were warmly greeted and quickly seated. The menu is extensive with several pizza options as well as several pasta, chicken, seafood and veal dishes.
Wine was very reasonably priced with glasses of house wine starting at just $5, a half liter for $12 and a liter for $20. I had a glass of their Sicilian Nero d'Avola ($6) which was dark, robust and filled to the brim ... HOOAH!
All meals come with soup or salad and fresh, warm, delicious bread and butter, ranging from $11 to $18.50. My wife had the Cheese Ravioli in Pesto Sauce ($12.50) and I the Veal Saltimbocca ($18.50). The salads were small, but fresh with lettuce, carrots, croutons and choice of dressing.
The ravioli was a bit of a disappointment with just ten on the plate, looking as if they were mass produced, not made in-house. The pesto sauce was pretty good, but my wife was still a bit hungry after finishing her small salad and ten medium size ravioli.
My veal was abundant and tasty, but not what I was expecting. Veal saltimbocca (alla Romana) normally comes with veal scallops topped with thin slices of prosciutto and topped with fresh mozzarella in a light sauce of butter, a little lemon and fresh sage, but this sauce was very spicy with a tomato base. It was good, but I was expecting something different. The spaghetti aglio e olio (garlic and olive oil) was also abundant and a good choice to accompany the saltimbocca.
My wife was born it Sicily and raised in Naples, Italy and I, beside being of Italian descent, lived in Italy for nearly three and a half years in addition to having traveled there extensively, so we have higher expectations than most when eating at Italian restaurants. Pizzuto's does a better job than many stateside Italian eateries and the prices are definitely affordable, but the food was not as authentic as it could have been. Had the salads been a little bigger, the ravioli more abundant, and the saltimbocca sauce more traditional, they would have definitely scored an extra bomb or two.
CombatCritic Gives Pizzuto's 6 Bombs Out Of 10 ... More Bombs Are Better!
restaurant_user_5_review: Reminds me of home! Very homie experience and they served delicious bread with garlic spread!! The pasta dishes we ordered were just amazing!! Our waitress was funny, helpful and super sweet!!! Diggin' this place a lot and def will go back when k get a chance.
restaurant_user_6_review:
My dad had been to Pizzuto's with friends and suggested coming here for dinner yesterday. I was a little worried cause I had to be home by 6:30 and we didn't get there till about 5:15 but everything went smoothly and I was hole in time.
They bring you a basket of hot scissor rolls I haven't had scissor rolls it was nice that the server said some were just out coming out of the oven and would be on there way. Entrees come with a small house salad don't see that often now days what a great touch. I grew up in Rainer Valley going to Vince's that's what Pizzuto's reminds me if a family owned restaurant great for family. It appeared
to be a neighborhood favorite. Wide variety of protein selections. Large portions and friendly service you'll definitely have leftovers. I had the shrimp scampi would probably go with a chicken dish next time flavor was good just expected the scampi to be a little bigger but wouldn't keep me from returning.
restaurant_user_7_review: Horrible service. Sat there waiting for our order for over an hour, before we finally gave up and left. It was not even a complicated order, and there was only two of us.
restaurant_user_8_review: Pizzuto's WAS my absolutely favorite Italian spot in Seattle and we tried to go 2 or 3 times a month. However, ownership changed and although they were given all the original recipes, they have slowly been changing the recipes. The last two times I was there I was really disappointed. The ala amatraciana was on penne instead of spaghetti, the sauce was sweet instead of spicy, the sausages didn't have the same density or housemade taste they used to. I walked out thinking, I don't really have any need of coming back. My suggestion to the owners is don't mess with perfect recipes.
restaurant_user_9_review: Fantastic staff ! Terrific warm bread ! The best meatball sandwich in the world . All the meals are outstanding ! And a wonderful dessert list !!! Bring the kids too .
restaurant_user_10_review: Horrible Italian food. Very mediocre Price is reasonable but I am not willing to pay for food that is not so good. Large portions over sauced. Pasta and meatballs not good. 1 star is too much.
restaurant_user_11_review:
Pizuttos is the perfect neighborhood Italian restaurant. I've been coming here nearly 20 years, since I moved to Seward Park.
Don't expect high end Italian, think red checked table cloths (though that just changed). Expect iceberg lettuce salad, minestrone, big portions, wonderful rolls and a great value in the 1/2 carafe wine.
We typically bring half our dinners home and we're not light eaters.
Always friendly staff and on a Friday night after a long week at work, Phone is a lovely way to unwind close to home and in the company of our neighborhood.
A gem and a blessing to have in this day of the next big thing dining in Seattle.
restaurant_user_12_review:
My review is a generous four stars.
Pizzuto's is like every other neighborhood Italian-American restaurant that you can find all over the country. The menu is extensive, the prices are low, and the servings are very, very large.
The restaurant was filled to capacity by 7:30 p.m. on a Tuesday night, and it appeared there were a lot of locals by the greetings of the serving staff. Our server Rae was very nice, friendly, and took good care of us in the crowded setting.
One caveat is that like most Italian-American restaurants, canned olives are used on all the dishes such as the salads and pizzas.
We tasted three dishes, and they were all well-prepared and quite good.
If you're looking for authentic Italian, well, this may not be the place for you, but the food is good enough to make me want to return.
restaurant_user_13_review: Excellent meal & atmosphere....had a party of 11 which they accommodated us well & waiter was personable. Have always had a delicious meal, last night Puttanesca!
restaurant_user_14_review:
Nondescript place between a law firm and a coffee shop. Food is decent, except for the meatballs. They are too spicy, especially for a kids serving off spaghetti and meatball. They either need to alter their recipe or make separate meatballs for the kid's meals. Chicken/Veal Parm are great.
The carbonara is ok, but doesn't have peas!
Pizzas are great.
restaurant_user_15_review: Great Italian food. Been here a couple times for family style dinners. Always a good spot for relaxed family dining. Tonight's service was very slow however. I hope this isn't the new trend in Seattle restaurants! I'll be back with fingers crossed for speedier service.
restaurant_user_16_review: This is exactly what you want from an Italian restaurant. Family-friendly service and delicious Italian food - with all of the classics. Our family ordered a custom pizza, carbonara, and a mixed Italian salad. Pasta tasted great with the Lucille IPA Excited to see this place continue to thrive.
restaurant_user_17_review: Low key but delicious Italian restaurant. I've had a few of the pastas, gnocchi and carbonara being my favorites. Haven't tried the pizza yet, but will go for that next. Always take a tiramisu home for dessert. Prices are pretty good for Seattle. The quantity is large enough to either share or take home for another meal.
restaurant_user_18_review: Great service and a forte sauce that has to be tasted to be believed - it is hot, spicy and DELICIOUS! The range of pastas are excellent. So, too, the Italian themed desserts. Save some space for the dessert.
restaurant_user_19_review: Horrible Italian food. Not sure why people like this place. I live only 3 blocks away and have been here twice. First time I didn't like it. And a year later, I thought, I'll give it another try. I was wrong. It still is awful. I got a chicken dish with mushrooms and artichoke. It tasted entirely like alcohol, like they didn't cook the sauce off enough. My son got the mixed spaghetti and ravioli with meatball and sausage. Marinara is sour and sausage very dry. I cook better than this at home! The only thing going for this place is that it's a neighborhood place, portions are really large, and free soup or salad. Price is reasonable but I'd be willing to pay a little more for better tasting food. This has the same stars as La Medusa, a top Italian restaurant in seattle which is strange and why I rate this restaurant a 1 star.
restaurant_user_20_review:
I know I am in the right place when I open the door and the welcoming aroma of roasted garlic wafts by. Food is very traditional/home-cooked comfort and the freshly baked bread is irresistible. Classics like veal parmigian with a side of bolognese spaghetti are delicious, and the heavier creamy pastas are perfect (especially if you're able to steal a few bites from your dining companion). MUST order the homemade caesar salad as your complimentary starter. The anchovies are mild and really add to the tasty, lighter dressing, but you can always request the salad with them. Service has always been warm and friendly. Friends recommend the pizza - I need to try it soon. I keep ordering an entree when I dine here. Highly recommended neighborhood gem!
To the owners: thank you for serving the community and warmest regards!

restaurant_user_1_review:
Wow, wow, wow, what an amazing experience; the perfect place for the romantic, quiet birthday dinner I wanted!
The food was absolutely delicious, from bread to dessert. The restaurant is cute, well decorated, cozy and charming. Parking is easy and plentiful.
We were lucky enough to have Leo as our server; outstanding service, great sense of humor, and ultra attentive.
This place really cares about your comfort, happiness and overall experience. One of the owners, Fernando, checked on us several times, and was so genuine in his desire to make sure we were having an amazing experience - nice touch!
We can't wait to visit again!
restaurant_user_2_review:
I wanted so badly for this place to be good. An upscale Italian restaurant would nicely flesh out the portfolio of Renton dining options. Unfortunately, despite a charming atmosphere, the food is just bad. Overpriced and bad.
My first visit I got the veal marsala and my companion got the chicken piccata. The veal was overly thick, unevenly cooked, and came in a watery, flavorless Marsala sauce. It tasted like cafeteria Salisbury steak. The chicken was somewhat better in so much as it tasted like chicken, but it was overcooked and tough. The Caesar salad was passable but certainly nothing to write home about.
I will give them credit for having a good tiramisu. Whatever bakery they partnered with is solid. Still, it was not enough to bring redemption to this establishment. Upon receiving the bill (over $100 for this debacle) I was filled with quiet rage.
Despite all of this, I foolishly returned to give them a second try. Nope. They sucked again.
restaurant_user_3_review:
We've been here twice now, and we like it.
Two dishes stand out for us: the Calamari Fritti, and the Tiramisu. My MIL got the Gamberoni Fiorentine which she really liked except that the spinach needed to be salted both times we were there. (They don't put salt on the table, so we had to ask for it to be brought, which is slightly embarrassing.) Hubs and I really love that fried calamari! We gobble it up like it's our last meal!
MIL also got the Chicken Picatta both times we were there, and she really loves it. Hubs did too. I got the Chicken Marsala on our first visit, and it was okay, but I wouldn't order it again. But in fairness to the restaurant, I need to explain. Many years ago, I tasted Chicken Marsala for the first time, and I fell in love with it. But I have never had one since then that tasted like that first one; nothing satisfies me. I'll optimistically order it on occasion, in the hope that I will love, it, but so far... no luck.
My recent main course was Alfredo with chicken. It was good, but the chicken pieces needed salt. The sauce didn't need salt, but the chicken did. (As I recall, the Marsala I ordered on my first visit also needed salt.) Hubby's recent main dish was Bolognese, which is often a favorite of his, but he said it was just okay.
On our first visit, we each got a dessert: the cannoli (no one really liked it very much), the raspberry-lemon tart (again, not that great), and the tiramisu (fantastic!). As far as we're concerned, the only dessert to get here is the excellent Tiramisu -- it's the best ever!
Both times we were there, we got seated at the same table, and had the same waiter. My MIL can be quite picky about her food preferences, and he was very accommodating. We appreciate that.
restaurant_user_4_review: This place was packed, we had a reservation and overheard walk in's talking with the host that there was a hour and a half wait. We had a small wait and then sat. We were offed bread with a pesto butter that my daughter was obsessed with. I ordered the tortellini con salmon and 2 glasses of the only moscato on the menu, the wine was very tasty thus why the second glass. The pasta was perfect although it was a hour before we got the food. I think the kitchen it a bit small for how many people were there. That is my only knock of the place. We never had a half filled water glass that is how attentive the wait staff was. Overall food was awesome and I would come back.
restaurant_user_5_review:
It was time for a dinner date with my friend, and we usually need plenty of time to decide on where to eat. But this time, she already had this place in mind, having heard about how good this place was from her friend, so that definitely saved us the difficulty of choosing a restaurant.
She got here first and already started on the complimentary bread with the tasty flavored butter. We both started off with a glass of pinot grigio ($9 each) the Calamari Fritti ($16). The fries calamari was good with the cilantro aioli, but wasn't the greatest. My friend ordered the Linguine di Mare and I ordered the Penne con Pollo Diavola.
