We will definitely come back to this restaurant!
restaurant_user_11_review: Amazing real old-school Italian preparations, not the usual Italian-American fare or Italian-inspired fusion. The owner and the cooks know their stuff, they do it right, and they take great pride in their work. We finished with a very fine Barros 20-year port
restaurant_user_12_review: Met the owner and chef, very nice folks. Lobster risotto was really good, salmon risotto was less so. Waitress was fairly inattentive and a bit spacey.
restaurant_user_13_review:
My brother and I had some strong cravings for Italian, so we decided to pull into this restaurant for dinner.
As soon as we entered the front doors, we could see the chefs whipping meals together right behind the front counter - I thought that was kinda neat. We were seated immediately and served water along with the menus.
I ordered the Alfredo Peppardelle and my brother got the Lamb-chops. When our food arrived, I thought the portion sizes were decent. The first bite made me grin from ear to ear! It was creamy and full of flavor. I loved it! I hate to admit this, but halfway through my meal, I was getting a bit tired of the flavor. It's not a flavor I can constantly eat for an entire meal.
Prices were also on the higher end. The two orders came out to about $80 for the both of us. That would have to be the biggest downfall for me since I know there are so many other options out there that come at a more reasonable price.
restaurant_user_14_review: Rich, delicious and will definitely be back! Having been my first visit, next time, and my recommendation, I think ordering dishes the table is interested in and taking bites of each would be best. The dishes we had were so good! Started with the focaccia bread (baked in house) of course with the clams Rockefeller (Rich, creamy and cheesy). For our entrees we have the pappardelle with mushroom/ truffle (so rich and sooo good, but hard to finish), the penne alla mike (lighter/spicy pink sauce with shrimp), and the lobster ravioli (richer pink sauce with great bites of lobster and veggies inside). We don't frequent Burien often but now have a new reason to return. The staff (Carmen) were fabulously friendly including the chef who greeted us upon arrival. The atmosphere is quaint and romantic.
restaurant_user_15_review: Love this place. I've only met one of the owners but he was very friendly and welcoming. I've been here about 5 times and it's my favorite place when I want Italian. Penne ala Mike is delish!!!
restaurant_user_16_review: I'm sorry you feel this way because much of what you're saying is inaccurate. I called and talked to the manager once. It was an uphill battle the whole conversation and never once did he agree to take responsibility for mistakes that were made. He indicated he would contact me with a resolution and that never happened. I never asked for free food for two persons. I was the one whose dish was incorrect and you made it again and also gave me a portion to take home. What I took home was still not correct. It was my mistake in saying that the freshwater prawns were lobsters. That said, it doesn't take away the fact that one of them was half again the size as the other and if you have two people sitting next to one another ordering the same dish, it's rather awkward. Also, I didn't have a special request with my pasta dish, rather I substituted the penne with linguine because I don't care for thick pasta. It shouldn't have affected how you made the dish. Lastly, I never asked you to have Michael stay or run the business. I simply stated that when he "was" running the business it was much more hands on, he cared more about the quality of food, the presentation and would actually come out and talk to the customers at their table. I maintain my review and I'm only sorry that you cannot be accurate about yours...
restaurant_user_17_review: Had heard great things about this place but it was just ok. Everything seems to come with a tomato cream sauce which is not very memorable. Saltimbocca sauce was watery, ravioli was not bad. Risotto was no true risotto as it was made with that pink tomato cream. Authentic risotto does not have a sauce, the creaminess should come from stirring the rice while it cooks. Caprese salad had hard ice cold tomatoes. Would have been better if they were room temp. Definitely not authentic Italian but had good service in a nice atmosphere. Probably won't go back.
restaurant_user_18_review: WOW. Just wow! This place is beyond expectation. Delicious and the atmosphere is beautiful. Elegant. Tried the traditional spaghetti and meatballs. Very good. Excellent and well prepared. Came for dinner. Next I had to try the tiramisu. Yummy! Very nice evening.
restaurant_user_19_review:
We had such a good dinner at Bistro Baffi a couple of nights ago! We went with a couple of friends, one from Canada (Victoria) and the other from Renton. None of us had been to the restaurant before.
Our server (I think her name was Rachel) was wonderful and made some great suggestions, since we were "newbies". We loved the stuffed mushroom appetizers, and the bruschetta was phenomenal! The bread was perfectly grilled and was not at all crunchy and hard. The tomato, mozzarella, and prosciutto topping was perfect. (The prosciutto was not on the menu, but Rachel said they were offering it that night as a special.)
We had the Ravioli D'Aragosta, Spaghetti Pescatore, and a Scallops dish for our main courses. Wonderful!
We had no room for dessert, but that didn't keep a couple of us from sharing the fabulous tiramisu - the best I have ever had.
We all agreed that we will be returning to Bistro Baffi again.
restaurant_user_20_review:
Recently, was in Burien on business and selected this charming restaurant since they took reservation and we were a large party. They had a dinning room that was perfect for our dinner. The service was gracious and personal.
Even better was the freshness of the fish - they bring table side the fresh fish of the day and tell you how it is prepared. Many of us had the Pasta di' Mare - which was delicious. Hard to imagine but we finished with some desserts - the limoncello sorbet was perfect!
It would be a favorite neighborhood gem if I lived nearby!
